Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Vinnie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom fireplace suit over looking the golf course and it was UNBELIEVABLE! It was our anniversary and when we entered our room, there was a cheese/fruit/champagne tray set out, the fireplace was lit, and there was romantic music playing from the radio. The staff was so nice and friendly and the property is beautiful. HIGHLY recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Traveler beware--this property is huge!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler S
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family and babysitter here for a week on vacation. The place we stayed was a house (actually half of a duplex house) in the residential area of the resort. It was nowhere near the main resort itself. Our whole family is comprised of big walkers, but even for us, the house was not walking distance to the main resort, so we were not able to take advantage of the restaurants, main pool, spa, or other amenities without using our car to get there. Even if the distance had been reasonable (which it was not), there were no sidewalks, and we would have had to walk along the main road (with our children, along a main road in wine country with no sidewalk!) to get to the main resort. In fact, the only actual "walking path" was really a golf cart path and the signs said it was restricted to golfers only. This place really seems to be all about golf. Also, our place was very dated. We most likely will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Silverado Napa Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mollduff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and got upgraded to a fireplace suite. It was lovely. Pretty, white, elegant. Used this as base for visiting Napa and many wineries. Had two tennis lessons on the gores tennis courts. My husband had nice yoga class one day. Refrigerator in the suite plus a microwave so we made our own breakfasts each day. Great area - close to everything. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Go for the golf, tennis, pool, spa and invest in the suite”
Reviews.Author: SusanJElDoradoHills
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate for our recent stay, but found that the room was very basic and small. The discounted room was the second bedroom of a 2-bedroom suite with a separate entrance. This is a wonderful, but slightly dated, resort that would be perfect for guests who take advantage of the golf, tennis, swimming or spa. In our case we were just looking for a nice place to spend a night while on a wine-tasting trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice apartment”
Reviews.Author: FeChefSeattle
Reviews.Content: We got a nice condo apartment for our 3-night 4-day Napa trip a few weeks ago for less than a price of a tiny hotel room. Yes, the place is somewhat dated, and aimed more for the older crowd, but the price made all of that very worthwhile. We booked massages at the Spa, and LOVED them. If you're looking for an ultra-modern hotel, this isn't it. If you're looking for a relaxing place to lay your head (and need/want a kitchen), this is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Too short a stay!”
Reviews.Author: Adrienna168
Reviews.Content: Silverado, on the outskirts of the town of Napa is located near the William Hill Winery, has very lovely landscape all around. If you like beautiful pools, what looks to be a great golf course, very comfortable rooms set up in small cottage complexes surrounded by Palm trees and well kept grounds, tennis courts etc..you can enjoy your stay here for sure. I have stayed in all levels of hotels and I would give this one an A. The service was great, people friendly and no problems at all, don't hesitate to make your stay here. Down side: Breakfast a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana S
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely great at our stay at this wonderful resort. The room service staff made us feel very special in the way that they attended to our every whim. The golf shop staff were also extremely friendly and well versed in their area of the resort. The grounds are breathtaking and are incredibly well maintained. I do a lot of traveling but that being said, this was one of my best experiences ever. It is a place I hated to leave and look forward to returning to as soon as I possibly can...

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing....don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl B
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, this was once a lovely property....but no longer. The rooms are 1980 decor; very tired. Terrible shower head. Plugs in sink area didn't work. Tried to get a drink to enjoy on the patio....only one overwhelmed bartender...waited forever. Went to the "spa" to workout, only to find out it was closed due to renovation. The "good" restaurant was also closed for renovation. The golf course was not maintained well. The whole place looks like its about to go out of business. And I won't be surprised when it does.

Reviews.Title: “Double Charged for a Room after Booking with Kayak”
Reviews.Author: Greg N
Reviews.Content: Please be careful with this resort. Their billing is quite unscrupulous. On 3/30/12, my wife made a hotel reservation for the Silverado Resort in the amount of $450.26 through Kayak for a two-night stay with her credit card. The entire stay for the hotel was paid in full from 4/6 through 4/8. When we checked in 4/6, I left my credit card at the front desk to cover incidentals for the stay. On 4/10/12, I noticed the hotel had charged me a second time for the stay. This time, the charge was $451.68. After seeing the 2nd charge, I immediately called the hotel to let them know there was an error. The front desk rep (Terry) said that the resort cannot refund my money until they are paid by Kayak. I informed Terry that the transfer of payments set forth in the agreements Silverado has with 3rd parties, such as Kayak, are covered under the Terms & Conditions with those particular parties. My wife paid through a 3rd party with payment protected under the agreement with Kayak. I educated Terry on the fact that these backend payment transactions are settled through the Resort's relationships with 3rd parties and do not involve the hotel guest with the exception of incidentals. She abruptly told me that I'd have to settle this with the book keeping dept. I left a message on 4/12 & 4/13 and I'm still waiting to hear back. After calling again on 4/13 to ask for a status, Terry answered the phone with a "YES!", instead of "Thank you for calling Silverado". I Googled the hotel manager (Nikolay Tevekeliyski | Director of Guest Experience) and left a voicemail for him at his office. I have yet to hear back. From the threads on TripAdvisor, I see that the only way to get a response from the hotel is to post a comment here. So here it is. I'm still waiting Silverado. On Friday (4/13), I said that if I don't hear back by close of business, I'll do a merchant-chargeback. The deadline has come and passed. Call me by 5PM today or you'll just have to deal with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “Only as a last "Resort"”
Reviews.Author: 869MattG
Reviews.Content: The front desk was way understaffed do to the fact that they have no clue how to keep a reservation. I went with a group and nearly everyone had a story of being put in a lower grade room at the same price or waiting 9 hours to have the room be available. Because of this, everyone that stays seems to have to wait at the front desk at least 5 times to get the right room and request the appropriate adjustments to the bill. Plenty of folks working the front door though. The rooms are nothing special. It seems like a timeshare where people offer their place when the aren't using it and the reservation system knows nothing about it. Sprawling grounds with rooms that you drive to or wait for a van constantly. Each room should come with a golf cart so you can get around. A waste of money. disappointing rooms. disappointing service. If they can get away with charging you for the room you reserved, while putting you in another smaller room, the will.

Reviews.Title: “It's just not worth it -- you can do better in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Buff_BL
Reviews.Content: This is a very expensive resort so the grounds are beautiful, the room is spacious, and they try hard with some services such as greeting you, concierge, etc. But, the total experience is just not worth the money. One caveat before I go into details. I'm not a golfer, so maybe the golf is so good it makes up for all the rest of it. Below I detail the pros and cons. Pros: --spacious suite with full living room, kitchen and bedroom with a very comfortable bed --quiet evenings so a good night's sleep --very pretty grounds, if that kind of thing is important to you. Cons: --fairly distant from any other sites, so unless you want to drive back toward Napa, you're stuck here. --the free wireless was so slow sometimes it wasn't even viable. --the $20 "resort fee" gives you some basics (internet, parking, paper). But, calling it a resort fee makes it impossible for many conference attendees to expense it. --there was tempered glass in a window next to the door with no curtain so you can see shadows of people in their room. As a woman traveling alone, that makes me uncomfortable. --the small window in the bathroom didn't shut. I don't think a person could get thru it, but it still made me feel uncomfortable. --my TV only got 5 channels and after 3 visits they still couldn't get it fixed. --the wood burning fireplace only burns fake logs and they don't replace them once you have burned them. --the bath was so small the door hits the toilet. --when they picked up my room service tray, they threw the uneaten food into my waste can, which created a smelly room -- are you kidding me? --the room service menu was supposedly 'out of date' and the newer options they gave me were higher priced. Scam? --my final bill had 2 meals in their restaurant on it that weren't mine. Hopefully everyone checks their bills when they leave. That was nearly $100 in charges that were not mine. --a small issue, but something that is basic at all hotels: they never replenished my toiletries, and I was there for 3 nights. --as others have mentioned, the decor is old fashioned. Bottom line is that this is an overpriced resort that is resting on the laurels of looking like an upscale luxury venue, but just doesn't live up to it. There are other nice little hotels and B&Bs in the area that are much better in experience and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great reasonable option in Napa”
Reviews.Author: MaryStanford
Reviews.Content: We needed two rooms, which is a more expensive proposition, but the two BR suite at the Silverado was perfect! I didnt expect much after reading some of the reviews, but we were all so ploeasantly surprised. Lovely 2 BR Condo on the golf course, renovated, fantastic beds, privacy for each room. There are more luxorious places in Yountville, etc, but this is a fantastic option. It's ahike to the clubhouse, but the free shuttle service is fast and reliable. We left behind two items and they sent to us immediately. All in all, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Boriana T
Reviews.Content: I had unforgettable stay at Silverado Hotel & Resort. My friend and I were guests from March 22 to 27th 2012, and we will never forget the homey atmosphere, the pleasant and helpful staff and the great energy at every single facility at Silverado resort. Our room was fantastic, housekeeping staff were excellent and overall we were extremely happy with all the services. Thank you for being so nice, thoughtful and welcoming. I will surely recommend your Hotel to all my friends and colleges. Boriana Tar

Reviews.Title: “Outdated - Rooms need updated from the1990's”
Reviews.Author: amber145
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four (4) nights on a Napa wine country long weekend. We focused on limo tours and enjoyed Napa at it's best excluding one day of rain. The Silverado Resort is a beautiful resort and is located well for getting up and down the valley for touring. We were glad to get settled after a long day in the air getting to California. The problems we had were with the dated accomodations. The rooms needed updating as the carpet was dark green (1990's) had ripples in it from the aging and poor maintenance. The countertops were Corian countertops from the 90's. The carpet was severly worn and was frayed at the transition going into the kitchen. The TV's were old style with remotes that would not work properly. One TV wouldonly get two(2) channels. They needed new flat panel TV's in both living area and bedroom. When I opened the sliding glass door, it became stuck, so with a little effort and pulling, it fell out of the frame onto the patio. The tub would back up when taking a shower and would take 10 minutes to drain after the shower was over. I looked at another room of a person in the group, and theirs was totally NEW. I made an effort to change to another room the night we checked in, but they could not find a room that had two queen beds in the bedroom. That was on a Thursday night. There was no consideration from management to refund any of the amount of the room from the sub standard accomodations that were leftover from the 90'S. If the room had not been so bad, I would have given the resort a Very Good instead of an AVERAGE.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: I just can't believe the negative reviews about this resort! We stayed this past week for 5 days, and loved every minute! We are in our 30's and live in NYC and love to travel, and we were pleasantly surprised. The resort has an old world southern charm about it as soon as you pull up to the driveway. The grounds, main building, golf course, restaurants and rooms are all very clean and well kept. The staff was beyond pleasant, Especially Matt, the Grill Manager! Even the bartenders loved to give us suggestions on other restaurants and vineyards to visit! Our room was the basic king sized guest room, and it was updated and very nice. After a long day of wine tasting, we always met at the grill bar to relax during wine happy hour. Some people will complain about ANYTHING and EVERYTHING! The staff at this resort seem to genuinely care about their guests having a great experience. We are already planning a trip back to Silverado with a group of friends this coming August!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great”
Reviews.Author: dianazi
Reviews.Content: We all gathered there for a wedding. The place is gorgeous. Our house was on the golf course and even in November this place was green and beautiful. I will go back one day I am back in Cali. Silverado people, keep on doing a great job. We were there for a short stay but I will never forget it.

Reviews.Title: “There is no Team in Service at the Sliverado Resort and Spa”
Reviews.Author: MCFarr1
Reviews.Content: It's too bad such a beautiful resort fails miserably on serving its customers. The Grill restaurant for lunch was staffed appropriately for the crowd they just did not take into account the employee gatherings. We had to flag a bus person down to sit us as the host/manager was nowhere to be seen. Our waiter was one of three there but only he had responsibility for taking orders, the others too busy chatting away amongst themselves. The manager finally showed up but was not concerned about the status of the lunch room. Food was average. Had to interrupt and ask the bartender to assist us with our bill as the waiter never returned to close us out. Our experience checking in was simple until we were told to see the bellman to show us how to get to our room and assist us with our luggage. After 5 minutes of waiting at an empty station we helped ourselves to a map and off we went to our room. Room was clean and spacious. Checking out was more of the same. Two managers were too busy chatting to assist the 7 guests in line where only one person working behind the desk was in slow motion. Other guests may have missed their flights. In a world class area with numerous top notch choices to choose from you can be sure the Silverado Resort will not be on our list in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our three bedroom house”
Reviews.Author: snorklefamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a weekend in Napa with good friends and really loved the three bedroom house that we reserved at the SIlverado resort. Check in and out, and service were excellent. The facilities are a bit dated. Our house felt a bit like Grandma's home with its older, but very well maintained, furnishings. We were there to celebrate a birthday and the resort thoughtfully delivered a 1/2 bottle of wine to our room upon arrival. Although we didn't take advantage of many of the hotel's amenities, we did brunch at the Grill. It was a fine buffet, though perhaps a bit pricey at $24/person. Overall, we really like the SIlverado Resort and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway in Napa”
Reviews.Author: sparky7356
Reviews.Content: Just got home from two night at Silverado with friends. This is our second time staying here. It's less than an hour from home, but what a great way to relax and really refresh. We did golf, tennis, spa, gym on property and took in the great sights and restaurants in the area the rest of the time. My pedicure by Dyan was the best ever! Be sure to request her--she is not only a great manicurist, but such a wonderful and interesting person. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the service great. The guys really loved the golfing and were so happy with the service. We were given a very early check-in (9:30 am--seriously, who does that?!?!?!) so we were able to drop off our stuff in room before heading off to the greens and spa. We didn't go wine tasting, but if that's what you're looking for, you can't do better than Silverado Trail.

Reviews.Title: “One Saturday night stay”
Reviews.Author: Blaine O
Reviews.Content: This was my birthday weekend. We at the last minut booked this hotel for 1 night on Saturday the 17th of March. We were greeted at the parking lot, then again at the door, and then againat check in. Check in was easy, quick, and simple. Was given 2 regular room keys and then a bell person showed us to our room by golf cart. We got into our room, it was brightly lit, clean, and roomy. Our room had a fireplace and it was used for a romantic night. Our room had a fridge, coffee maker, stove top, toaster, sink next to the stove top. It was a mini kitchen. We were pleasantly surprised. That was a plus. The view from our 2nd floor room was great. Not sure what the negative comment are about this hotel, I guess people need to remember this is a 4 star hotel and it lives up to every star. We have stayed at several hotels in our lives and I will say this is one of our top 3 hotels. I would stay here again and recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The only place for me in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Barbarazway
Reviews.Content: I must say, I wanted to stay here but then opted for another resort initially. On the eve of the visit, I changed my plans and booked at Silverado and I am SO happy that I did. The resort is wonderful. Upon driving up, you see this gorgeous old manor with a very friendly reception. Mike was our bellman and he was lovely and informative. Our room exceeded my expectations. I booked a standard as we only stayed one night, but it was divine. Roomy, with a fireplace. Soft bed with nice bedding. It even had a small kitchenette and fridge. The gym in the spa is perfect and a must for those fitness types. I always try to select a place with a gym and often find then nice but on the small side. The Silverado Resort's gym is spacious and state of the art. The spa is reasonable priced as well. We were checked in promptly and with great customer service. The price is very reasonable and for an additional small fee you get access to the gym, tennis courts, pools and free and fast wifi. I was very impressed and would come back again for sure. My only regret is I only booked one night as this is a place I could easily enjoy for a couple of nights. Top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience and a must come back!”
Reviews.Author: Candy S
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic get away for me and my sister and we left yesterday. We had travelled the pacific coast from LA and were in so need of relaxation. This resort offered so much . We loved the 1 bedroom suite with a fireplace and we were blessed to be overlooking the golf course and the mountains. The beds were super comfy and mostly the comforter was really cosy that i did not leave my room the next day. The staff were also great and we just loved the whole experience that we will definately be back with our potential others in the future. The spa (body wrap room) however was not as great, it lacked the ambiance that you should get when you are getting a body wrap. I had an organic body wrap that cost $186 including the gratuity which was just sub-par. I have had better experiences. I only hope they can re-vamp that treatment room and make it more cosy. There was really no spa feeling in this particular room that all body wraps are done. Otherwise the masseusse was very friendly but the lady in the front desk (Ashley) or sth was rather rude over the phone. I would recommend taking a tour of the spa before booking their treatments. Their towels were also really old, rough and brown which also doesn't give you a spa feeling. I had to ask for the white towels that were in the changing rooms. The changing rooms and showers and bathrooms were also great and their gymn was also okey. On a positive note though the accomodation is really really nice and as i said, i would still return but use the spa at a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: SandyB55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. We had a condo with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. It was right on the golf course. We arrived about 8 pm and the staff was great! The bellman offered to take us to our condo, which was about a block away, but we found it just fine. It was very clean, quiet, and the beds were great. Beautiful atmosphere!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: LyzSF
Reviews.Content: Being from San Francisco, I spend a fair amount of time in Napa, having stayed at multiple hotels in the area, we decided to try out Sliverado. Booked two rooms at The Sliverado Resort this past February. Upon arrival (6pm) we were told our rooms were not ready, after waiting nearly an hour we checked into our rooms at 7pm. Rooms are dated and lack cleanliness, we had trail mix in our closet, which was obviously left over from the last guest. In addition, it was my wife's birthday and our good friend had arranged for champagne to be waiting in our room, it was not there. Our friend had to contact the resort several times before she was able to have the champagne delivered (well after dinner). Now, three weeks after our stay I was charged a resort fee, I have no problem paying a resort fee, however this was not mentioned to me upon check-in or check-out, I should have been charged that day. When I called the resort, they said their billing got "messed up" for the weekend I stayed there. So they charged peoples credit cards much later, they didn't have any of my information on file (because I booked through a third party), so they couldn’t contact me. I explained my dissatisfaction; being billed three weeks after a hotel stay, without my authorization is bad business. There was no effort on their part to remedy the situation. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean resort”
Reviews.Author: Ken L
Reviews.Content: clean and comfortable resort, spacious rooms. Great breakfast options

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: FrankChaps
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Silverado Lodge. The service was outstanding and the hotel employees were all very friendly. The room was very nice and clean with comfortable beds and a nice living room area and kitchen. Room service options were a bit limited but this is really nitpicking. The high-speed internet was extremely slow but free. Great experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair access”
Reviews.Author: Wheelchair-Bandit
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by Silverado's wheelchair access. We were given a suite near the restaurant that must have been designed by someone in a wheelchair. The bathroom and kitchen were perfect for use by a person in a wheelchair. The staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “hotel”
Reviews.Author: stacydc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up until we pulled away, the sevice was impeccable! We must have been greeted by 4 different people before we were there 5 minutes. This resort has the ambiance of a being plush and relaxed. It is spread out over many acres with two golf courses and several pools including a lap pool at the spa. The spa staff were even more amazing than the hotel staff. We felt so pampered! Our bellman, Mark L. was fantastic as he took us by golf cart to our own unit. He shared the story of the resort and all the details we would need, including how to get more wood for our fireplace. This was great Valentine's Day weekend. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “only stay here for the golf at Silverado”
Reviews.Author: pmbpmb
Reviews.Content: out in the middle of nowhere, which is nice, very quite and tranquil but rooms were dusty and courses in rough shape. great rooms though, very private and spacious. would go back. . . met johnny miller in pro shop which was Very Cool

Reviews.Title: “Fine, we really liked the spa nearby”
Reviews.Author: Super593
Reviews.Content: The resort is fine, maybe better if you're a golfer. Condo rentals - our tv didn't work correctly so we couldn't watch the movies even though we called and requested they fix it over our 3 night stay. Also there were other minor repairs (e.g. shorted out lamp, dead bolt not adjusted so you could lock the door) that needed to be done while we were there. We had a good time in spite of the problems, but it certainly would have made the price seem more reasonable had the place been in really good shape. We had spa treatments at the spa close to the resort - the facials were excellent and the massages were fine.

Reviews.Title: “Silverado service disappoints”
Reviews.Author: Art770
Reviews.Content: We were at the beautiful Silverado as a gift from our daughter and son-in-law. We arrived well after the 3:00 check-in time (4:30) and our room was not ready, and the desk clerk had no other room. After an hour, we asked the concierge for directions to the nearest drug store, and she printed out directions to a store 20 minutes away. We got there to find it closed. When we returned to the resort, still no room at 6:30, and the clerk did not have another clean room. He admitted that they were short housekeeping staff We cancelled the reservation and drove home. Hotel custom should have required the clerk to offer us an upgraded room or a room at a nearby hotel. On our way out, we saw a drug store 5 minutes away. So, bad check-in curtesy, bad housekeeping planning, unhelpful concierge.While I'm at it, I'll mention that the valet rifled through the golve compartment and closed cubbies in my car looking for the key before coming in and asking me for it.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay in wine country”
Reviews.Author: jdpollaro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend with my wife and 4-month old daughter. No complaints about the resort or our room. Very clean and comfortable. Close to several wineries. We didn't spend much time enjoying the amenities of the resort. Only reason I rate it as a 4 vs a 5 is that some of the furniture and kitchen area are a little dated. Still fully functional however. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Not a golfer”
Reviews.Author: Dave H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb and are not golfers. A nice quiet location and greeted by a nice staff and escorted to our room, We spent a couple of days exploring the wine country and this resort is located just off the Silverado wine trail. We were told by some locals that the they are under new ownership and it appeared that there is some renovation underway. Would probably stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “mariawill”
Reviews.Author: Maria W
Reviews.Content: We spent the night before Valentines, as we pulled into the property it gave you a feel of New Orleans style plantation, your greeting at the front door with directions to reservation, at reservation your offered fruit and old style keys. Then your escorted to your room by the bell captain via car. They were very knowledgable about restaurants and the area, things to check out in town. We had a fire place in our room it was very clean cottage though we did not walk around the huge property we spent a very romantic evening together. My husband and I was given directions to the most wonderful restaurant in town and was able to ride to Walmart and get right back to the room and relax all night long. Wonderful place plan on going again maybe this weekend and the rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...”
Reviews.Author: Viajerosin
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at the Silverado. The resort is big, with lots of empty spaces. They could create some cozy ambiances around the property. Our suite was big but the decoration overall is very dated. There are 2 restaurants but one was closed. The front desk staff was very kind and the check in was really easy. We went to the main lounge for a drink. They have a nice area with some tables viewing the golf course. We sat down on one of the tables that needed to be clean. After 10 minutes or so, a waiter came and drop a menu, he did not say anything, no greeting, he did not clean the table and he never came back to take our order. We decided to go to the bar to get our drinks. There's also a spa with a nice swimming pool. It was OK for a weekend, the price was decent but I don' t think we would go back. Considering other nicer and more quaint hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing with air conditioning which constantly malfunctioned.”
Reviews.Author: rickybob
Reviews.Content: This did not feel like the Napa luxury resort. Aid conditioning never worked. Rooms a real hike to main area. Wine selection at bar inadequate. Disinterested staff confirmed I will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, nice course, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi L
Reviews.Content: Very impressive resort with great accomadations, unfortunately customer service is not a priority. We were so excited to find this place until the pro shop and bar made us feel unwelcome. Not so sure we will give them a second chance.

Reviews.Title: “Love, loved this spa and golf resort!!”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaNancy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from California last week (Jan 14th, 2012) and for 2 nights myself and my partner stayed at the Silverado Resort in Napa. We rented a one bedroom suite with a view of the golf course. The room was clean and wonderfully decorated. The kitchen was well equipped, enough so I could make a full pasta meal for Sunday dinner. The resort is well located and not far from all the best wineries. And the staff couldn't have been friendlier and more accommodating. The food at the grill was great. And even though we didn't have a reservation staff moved around furniture to give us a table with a view of the football game for my boyfriend lol. It was a very classy resort with a warm and cozy feeling. I would definitely stay there again on my next trip. Worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Mara G
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended to me by a friend and I was not disappointed. It is probably one of the nicest hotels in Napa. The rooms are clean and the main house is beautiful! This is my first ever review here on Trip Advisor and the reason I decided to write one for this place is because of their excellent service. When we got there, we wanted to watch a boxing fight on pay-per-view but couldn't find it on the menu. The hotel was kind enough to send an engineer to our room to have it checked out. After checking out, I realized that I forgot my coat in our room. I called the hotel a few days after and they found my coat! I asked them if they can ship it to me and I would pay for the shipping costs. They willingly agreed to send it to me and pay for shipping! Now that's what I call service!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Would come again!”
Reviews.Author: great111
Reviews.Content: Overall very nice ! Glad we were not there for golf cause the weather was not good! Good value as 2 couples stayed in the 2 bedroom fireplace suite and we were very pleased!

Reviews.Title: “get a renovated suite”
Reviews.Author: jv282
Reviews.Content: Napa hotels are a bit polarized - you can stay at a $800/night five star resort or an $80/night motel. Silverado is one of the few hotels that fall in the middle. Silverado also didn't require a 2-night minimum during peak season when most hotels did. Beautiful grounds and a good home base for wine country, but note that this is more of a golf resort than anything else. If you are traveling in a group I highly recommend getting a two-bedroom suite. Make sure to request a suite that has been updated. Note that all the bungalows are actually condos that are owned by members and are managed and leased out as hotel rooms by the hotel. As a result, every room is a bit different in terms of decor and updates. However, there is so much to see and do in wine country that you probably won't spend too much time in your room. Did not golf during my stay but have heard good things about the two golf courses on the property. Overall, a decent, comfortable home base for a wine country trip but not incredibly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “It was great! Especially the upgrade . . .”
Reviews.Author: DayTripper1959_9
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before booking this time and I've been to the Silverado on two other occasions, staying in condos. This time I booked a hotel room, kept my expectations somewhat low based on what I'd read, and headed out with the attitude we just wouldn't stay in the room much (and it was just one night). Upon arrival, the man at the front desk offered my daughter and I an upgrade. As we exited the building, the bellboy asked if he could lead us to our room - so we followed his van in our car. He was polite, helpful, and full of positive energy (as was the young man at the front desk). Our upgrade was a condo with two queen beds, a fireplace, full kitchen, and patio! The beds were cozy, warm and very comfortable.The upgrade to a condo transformed our short trip. The Grill was great for dinner after wine tasting and for breakfast the next day as well. The service was fabulous at the bar and the restaurant. Each employee we met at the hotel and bar/restaurant went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “All show no substance”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort last minute for a couple of nights and the initial impression as you drive to the resort is great. The main building is grand and the staff eager to help. Sadly, it is downhill from there. The room was distant and furnished like a 1970s bedsit. It was also freezing. There is a real fire in the room which had one small duraflame log that burned sadly in the grate and when it went out and we asked for some more we were told we would be charged for them. Meanwhile we struggled to access their free but totally inadequate wifi which seemed to spend 80% of the time out of order. We tried The Grill restaurant and though the food was acceptable the ambience is of a very tired golf club. If you want to come for the golf or to pass out after a wine tour, this 'resort' is probably fine, for the rest of you, avoid this hotel there are so many better options in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Championship course, world class accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Jfeil
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms. We had a 2 bedroom suite with kitchen. The kitchen was awesome and appliances state of the art. They had a log for the fireplace and a first class BBQ too. Golf course was fantastic and in great condition.

Reviews.Title: “great hospitality in wine country”
Reviews.Author: znameshop
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to California for our nephew's wedding, we decided to take in a little R&R in wine country. We were looking for a place to relax and one that could accommodate the family of 6 adults (3 rooms with accessibility for one) at the spur of the moment on a Sunday night. Luckily our tripadvisor mobile app guided us to the Silverado resort in Napa. The staff was welcoming and very helpful in guiding us to our condo rooms at the edge of the golf course(We discovered a great walking path around early in the morning before the golfers showed up but asked for a ride back from the bell cap staff so as not to get lost getting back on the roads). The onsight restaurant was fine dining and the outside patio service for drinks allowed a gorgeous California view.. It was a beautiful oasis and we will plan to stay there again when visiting the area from Maine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Jagmia
Reviews.Content: I stayed with family for 2 days in Dec 2011. We have been treated well by staff and service. We enjoyed our stay at Silverado

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service...but peculiar room layout”
Reviews.Author: Al-Burj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights with my mother. As others have pointed out the service at the hotel is excellent and the hotel and surrounding areas were beautiful. My one concern was the room layout which was odd. There was no window in the room, the entrance to the room was a sliding glass door. If you closed the curtains for privacy there was no way to see out. If you left the curtains open to be able to see out, then anyone passing by could see EVERYTHING in the room. The room should have a curtain that is solid for the bottom 2/3rd but mesh for the top 1/3rd so that when it is closed people can't see into the room, but you can still see the sky and let some natural light in. The other problem with the room was that the sink was outside with the beds and so the bathroom was very small and just had the toilet and the shower. This made getting ready in the morning awkward as the bathroom was too small to get dressed in. The only other slight negative is that the wifi was REALLY slow at times. However overall this is a wonder hotel and the excellent service really made up for any short comings of the room layout. For people who are particular about having a window or a sink IN the bathroom they should know ahead of time and make sure they get a different type of room at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort with dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: IslaBonita77
Reviews.Content: The Silverado as a property and resort is wonderful. I have stayed here twice. This year, I was in a room; two years ago, I had a one-bedroom suite. Both times, the rooms were dated and needed a sprucing. Note that both rooms were clean and nicely-appointed, just older-looking than the rooms pictured on the website. My bed linens were not of poor quality or uncomfortable, but they certainly were older -- the comforters were floral patterned. The additional bed quilts were pilled and aged. The carpets were a bit worn as well. The bathrooms have a heater/fan option, but both seemed to pump out the same hot air and had a loud, humming sound. With the slight drawbacks of the rooms noted, I can say that the resort, the grounds and the staff are all lovely. It is a bit back from town, but just off the main winery roads. I have not played golf there, but companions who have raved about the course. The workout facility is bright, clean and full of machines. Still, my favorite exercise was walking around the grounds and the roads in and around the propery (be mindful of cars on the narrow and winding roads). Overall, I would like a bit nicer rooms for the price, but it is a high quality resort.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Sanrod
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in a villa unit at Silverado and it was most enjoyable. Whilst the units are remote from the main hotel/club house area, it was a pleasant walk across the course or there is the welcome option of the complimentary transport from villa to the main hotel. Only downside for us was that the resort is a little distance from town and we didn't have a car but taxis were reasonably priced and the service was good. Rooms were good, with most of what we needed in them. Nice little outdoor area overlooking the golf course which we used until the rain came!! Very pleasant stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: nattchai
Reviews.Content: Great service, golf course, rooms. Located in between Napa and Sonoma. Awesome resort!! I will more than likely revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: Melanie U
Reviews.Content: I recently got married at this beautiful resort, and couldn't have asked for a better experience. From the friendly staff (everyone including the bellhops, valets, servers, and bartenders were incredibly helpful and kind) to the delicious banquet food (both the filet mignon and salmon were excellent!), the comfortable rooms to the awesome on-site wedding coordinator Aminah Mitchell, everything was just about perfect. The members of our wedding party as well as numerous relatives and friends stayed at Silverado for our wedding weekend, and it turned out to be a nice, relaxing mini-vacation for everyone. Several of the guys golfed on the property, while the women went out wine tasting and shopping. The ceremony site at The Grove, situated out among the golf courses, is a lovely backdrop for a wedding, and the Fairway Deck and Ballroom were ideal settings for cocktails and dinner/dancing. We also held a morning-after brunch on the Fairway Deck that turned out wonderfully. Silverado provided us with a one-bedroom fireplace suite for our wedding night that was amazing--and we returned to the room to find champagne, chocolates, and a handwritten card (along with leftover desserts from the reception), all of which were thoughtful touches. All in all, we had a fabulous experience and will recommend the resort both as a Wine Country hotel destination and as a wedding/reception venue!

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: DaveTurlock_ca
Reviews.Content: This will be our third year we've stayed at the Silverado Resort the first weekend in December. The Christmas decorations and lights in the evening are just the way to get us in the Christmas mood. Fantastic resort, great golf with our room overlooking the course and fun shopping at the outlet stores during the day to get everyone on our list the perfect gift. It's a great get away for us, simply pleasure. I highly recommend, so much to do or just relax by a fire place with some Napa Valley wine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf Retreat in Napa”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed the weekend at this beautiful resort at the South end of Napa. My husband played golf, while I relaxed, and got caught up on my reading. The staff that I encountered were all very responsive, despite the fact that the resort seemed to be very full. The resort is large and spread out, however I always found very convenient parking right near our unit. I understand that some of the rooms have been more recently renovated than others, so I encourage you to ask for a recently renovated room, if you plan to spend much time inside.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get past the age and dust the best massage ever awaits”
Reviews.Author: Sofia R
Reviews.Content: Prior to my arrival in San Francisco, I researched travel to Napa from the airport including calling the concierge at the Silverado who quoted me nearly $200 or more for the one way trip. After my own research I found the Fairfield Airporter http://napacarfree.net-flow.com/airports_sfo.htm which was an incredible deal. It was just $75 from the airport to my hotel. They told me that could be a shared ride, but it was not (I booked 48 hours before). If I wanted a guaranteed solo ride it was $95. Well worth it. The car was immaculate and the driver was very sweet and talkative. I arrived at the hotel a little close to 2 and was able to check in and leave a key for my friend who was arriving later. I mentioned to the concierge about the car service I found in case they wanted to tell others and was treated rudely and told that they were fine with their resource. This was strange to me that they wouldn’t have wanted to share with others. I was driven to my room in a golf cart. The property is huge and it can be easy to get lost especially upon arrival. The bell staff was incredibly helpful and nice. The rooms were very clean and had a huge shower with heater in the ceiling. The beds were also very comfortable. I had a spa appointment at 4:30, so I wanted to get a workout in and enjoy the amenities prior to my appointment. I was offered a ride to the gym from the same bell staff and took them up on it. The gym is actually across the street from the property. I was greeted by Roy who was eager to be of any help. He was incredibly personable and smiled every time I came into contact with him. When I went in the gym the first thing I noticed was how dirty all of the machines are. The elliptical I used was covered in dust and dirt. The machines were dated. The one I used had a functioning TV built in and the actual machine worked, but the next day when I went back with my friend the machine next to it worked but you would not utilize the workouts or timers on the machine. Overall the gym was pretty dirty and machines were dated. It was sufficient, but be prepared. I went to the spa and was greeted by Adriana who was also very sweet. She showed me around the spa and locker room which she was constantly keeping clean. There is a sauna, hot tub and shower facilities. That was filthy and old. The changing area and the shower were clean, but the hot tub was gross. There were dead flies in the water and debris; the walls of the hot tub were also filthy. I then went into the waiting area just to relax. The other visitors to the spa were very loud which I find can happen when you are a spa with people who only get treatments once and awhile and may not know etiquette. The lounge area had some snacks including cranberries and almonds but the dish they were in and the spoon to scoop them out was very dirty. I have to tell you that despite all of this, the best massage I ever had awaited me. I was greeted by Laura. I scheduled an 80 minute massage and I will be thinking about how I felt after that massage for a long time. Laura was excellent. She was very skilled and knowledgeable. I was the only person in the spa and I felt like I was the only one in the spa. She treated like a VIP. I was able to select the lotion she used based on scent and she even asked if I wanted the music changed to something else. For me, she used the perfect amount of pressure to get my knots out and allow me to relax. After my treatment, she offered the multi shower head shower for me to use and suggested the sauna. I did take her up on the sauna. She went and brought me a cool towel for my face and even offered to make me tea. I left with a giant scrub brush for my back as a gift from Laura and the best massage I have ever had. If you decide not to stay at the Silverado, you must still schedule some time with Laura. I will return to the area and will not miss another chance to receive a treatment with Laura. This hotel is great for golfers and has recently been purchased by some investors in the golf world who have some long term plans at renovation. They are starting with the courses then moving on to the rooms. You need a car if you are staying here to get to Napa or Yountville or you will be paying $30+ each way. If this was helpful please give me a helpful vote. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “"Great place for a Napa Valley getaway."”
Reviews.Author: Jim489
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Silverado on a recent weekend getaway for a regional food and wine event. Our one bedroom suite was great, very well appointed, comfortable and spacious. Food and service all around were terrific. Mark who took us to our room was very helpful. Even in the rain, the Silverado and the Valley were beautiful. We attended a large event dinner while there and the food and service were outstanding and the event very well organized. We look forward to staying at the Silverado again.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Review”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I very much enjoyed our visit to the Spa at Silverado. Laura Prien gave me a fantastic Deep Tissue Massage and Janice Sharp in the Salon, did a great manicure & pedicure!!

Reviews.Title: “reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: calcor
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a condo unit, 4 of us, with ample room. we had a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom unit with complete kitchen, dining area and sitting area. although it is a little outdated, the rooms were comfortable. the bathroom/shower was a bit tight but the sink/counter area (separated by a door) was fine. it is not the nicest place in napa valley but overall a good value. the spa was nice with very courteous staff. the staff upon check in at the hotel was not so friendly. there was no formal greeting and she basically got right down to business without even cracking a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a Napa vacation”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful long weekend at the resort and will certainly choose this property again for our next visit. The location is ideal for a Napa trip. The staff is exceptional at the front desk, the restaurants, the spa and housekeeping. Especially friendly and efficient are the bell men who whisk you to your suite in a golf cart. We stayed in a one bedroom junior fireplace suite and while it is a little dated it was a perfect place to come back to after our return from a day of wine tasting. My only complaint about the room was the low flow toilet that needed to be re-flushed each time and the noise from our neighbors above. The walls and floors seem a bit thin for a resort of this quality. We were told that the suites will be updated over the next three years so we hope to return and expect them to be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: rjcro
Reviews.Content: Only there for a quick business trip but found the property beautiful, clean, and the staff some of the best I have ever dealt with. Special thank you to Davin Jordan. He was professional and extremly helpful. Customer Service at its best.

Reviews.Title: “first and last time staying at Silverado Resort”
Reviews.Author: GreatBlueFish
Reviews.Content: Requested a room without a connecting door due to past negative experiences with noise from adjoining rooms. They indicated only had units with connecting doors. Sure enough, that evening heard the neighbors belching and talking loudly through the door. Additionally, the low flow toilet recharged numerous times throughout the night for no apparent reason, it was LOUD and woke us up. We were in the first floor unit, could hear the guests in the room above us walking around. No refrigerator in the room, no bottled water in the room. Room was clean. Overall, not a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: Hamilton W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at resort during the Live in the vineyard weekend -The trip to California was great but staying at the resort made it even better -This was my first time to the area and when I open the doors to my room for the weekend I was thrilled to be staying here. -I would recommend to any out of town guest or even those that stay in California and want to have a nice get away from the city life -The staff was nice and helpful -The service was wonderful -The place was like a home away from home. -When I return I will request the same room Suite 406

Reviews.Title: “Napa experience”
Reviews.Author: akruckemyer
Reviews.Content: The Silverado is like an aging movie star. From a distance and if you don't look too close it looks good. But on closer inspection, It is old and in need of repair.

Reviews.Title: “Napa perfection”
Reviews.Author: EKBogart
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and the staff are extremely accomodating. We're only here for a night but they got us in to our rooms swiftly, thanks to Christie at the front desk who was excellent, and Mark who got us to our rooms in a golf cart, even in the rain! They gave us great directions too. The rooms were relaxing and all in all it made our business trip pleasure. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: musicbecca2
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful staff (Mark was THE GREATEST!) and the resort really lends itself to the laid back and relax-inducing atmosphere and explorability of Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “This Resort could actually ruin your entire stay in the wine country...don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: Triporamas
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the grounds you immediately feel like your entering a retirement villa. It's old and you can see right through the cheap attempt to give the "Mansion" a face lift..a very bad dose of Botox! The real gem here is what's called the standard room. Its a room that they have divided in half; my half had a sliding glass door with a flimsy metal bar for a lock and a door inside the room, which was for the other poor sap like myself!

Reviews.Title: “few minor improvements would make this great”
Reviews.Author: Canadian1667
Reviews.Content: food was great, villas have some nicely renovated areas, but need to replace old carpeting and sofa in living area....need to heat the pool and put a hot tub in! Need to replace old air conditioners with new units or even better central air.Staff was great, did not golf but planning to next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: soccermom19
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews about this resort, I was a little nervous about our trip. I was very relieved when we got there - we had a great experience! We travel quite a bit and although this was not a new, modern resort it had everything we needed and the grounds were beautiful. Our Room: We had the one bedroom Fireplace Suite with a golf course view (2nd floor). The room was recently redecorated and VERY nice. Large sliding windows with curtains you could easily close. The view of the golf course was amazing. The sunrise was beautiful coming up over the mountain. We had a nice kitchen with refrigerator, and everything we needed. We enjoyed our wine in the dining area and also had a nice living room with a plasma TV (overlooking the course). The king bed was very comfortable and I loved the bathroom with the "heater". Mornings are cold in Napa. Dining: We purchased the package that included breakfast. We received two $25.00 gift certificates every day we were there. There is a wonderful breakfast buffet on the weekends with an omelet bar and a regular breakfast menu on weekdays. The food was great. We did not have lunch or dinner at the resort - we were too busy driving around to the different vineyards and towns north of Napa. Spa: We had a pedicure and a massage. The women in the salon were very nice to visit with and did a great job. No problems at all - it was nice. We had a great 50 minute massage (should have purchased 90 minutes). It went too fast! The spa was clean and nice. It wasn't the most modern spa I have ever been to, but it was nice and clean. Great staff. Golf: My husband said that the golf was amazing. The greens were in good shape. The staff was very helpful. He did say that he preferred the North course, but the South course was still nice! We watched Johnny Miller as he taught a golf class one morning. Overall, the resort is very nice. If you are looking for something similar to the Four Seasons, you will not find it in Napa. This place is older, but it has character and we did not have any problems with the staff. There were a few conventions going on while we were there, but they did not let it interfere with our activities. You check into the main "lodge" and then drive to your room. We had covered parking right in front of our room. We walked to breakfast every day in the main lodge. Remember that this is the ONLY resort in Napa that includes two golf courses on site. I highly recommend! We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room if you upgrade!!! Very expensive breakfast!!!”
Reviews.Author: claraemejia
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 5?30 p.m. and discover that our bedrooms were very basic. Ours had window door that was half blocked by the curtains. It meant that the room had very little natural light and the worse: the humidity smell was terrible. My brother´s room was like any room you rent in a motel... no privacy at all. We had to make an upgrade and we got a nice room with fireplace and a small patio and my brother got a nice room in the second floor with a balcony... It meant 100 bucks more.... The breakfast...delicious but very expensive!!!! I only take coffee and some bread and they charged as if I had full breakfast. Monday thru Wednesday they have a small buffet and you can order from the kitchen, but on weekends you have to ask for the buffet, no matter what and they charge 25 USD plies tax plus 20% service.... Toooo expensive.... Go to Napa town for breakfast. Athousand times better and cheaper!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting for the cost.”
Reviews.Author: 1tallmom
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to see how small and dark our room was. There is virtually no natural light in the room. Thankfully we are in the Napa Valley so we could occupy our time and use the room only to sleep. Had I intended to lounge around the room it would have been depressing. The internet connection was terrible thus our IPad signal went in and out as well as our laptop connection. An AC compressor is below our window. This unit goes on and off during the night. Our room was very clean and well stocked. The staff members have been especially accomidating. Our dinner at the grill was excellent. Their grounds were beautiful. Our only complaint really is that our room was void of natural light and we had no view whatsoever. The decor in our room was nice and comfortable. It was evident they were doing the best they could to update the room but the white walls and white linens could not make up for the fact that we had three narrow windows side by side that looked toward the parking lot and provided very little view of the lovely surrounding areas. If you don't have a view of the golf course you will not have a view. My husband said staying in these rooms is like sleeping in a cubicle.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at cottages”
Reviews.Author: catraveller98
Reviews.Content: Good for traveller who booked golfing at ther resort (separate charge) updated bathroom, very friendy and helpful concierge -- 60s room, very expensive and compulsory 22 /day resort charge, inconvenient cottage away from lobby LCD TV with only analog channels

Reviews.Title: “Aging Titan is still phenomenal value”
Reviews.Author: OnlineConcierge
Reviews.Content: It is a golf and country club, and an aging one at that; but it is incredible. I have really enjoyed it, for years. It seems a place that I end up returning de facto, when we can't afford something like Bardessono... There are a multitude of rooming options for every price point, it is very close to other wineries (not to mention the more bucolic and less trafficky Silverado Trail for wine tasting...) while still being in a more private area than the teeming madness and crowds of places like Yountville. Relaxing as all get out.. pools and hot tubs, tennis courts and golf, everywhere. The Royal Oak restaurant in the clubhouse is phenomenal, and the Clubhouse has a great bar / lounge too. The breakfast buffet is a treat too. There is a lot of complexity in owning a resort that has so many separate owners of units... so you may walk into a dated unit with old art and furniture, or one that is fully updated with modern amenities... but this inconsistency is that of the owners, and not the operator... so don't hesitate to ask if the unit you are booking has been recently updated! They seem to offer deals and packages on their social accounts too... so look out for them! Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for an event”
Reviews.Author: Rorry
Reviews.Content: It's clear from the responses that Erika Opp wants to improve things but this resort has some fundamental issues which would be impossible (without flattening the whole place and starting again) to resolve. The room types and locations are not becoming of a resort which pitches itself way upmarket and it's not a good choice for an event. OK, I arrived very early, but it was annoying to have to wait several hours for "my" room when colleagues who arrived later were immediately given rooms - in this day and age, is it really impossible to allocate rooms on arrival, especially for a large group (there appeared to be no room hierarchy, colleagues had random types of rooms)? I think I must have had the most basic type of room, but it was clean, the floor (I had a ground-floor room) in basin area and bathoom (which did have a tub, with shower over) was tiled, everything worked and the only slightly worn looking area was the carpet in the bed area - but it wasn't stained etc. I think a crucial thing here is to get a nice size and location of room. I was in the 700's area and each building has 4 suites and 4 singles split on two floors. The singles look towards the garages and then the road. The room, for a "resort" was surprisingly small - the king bed pretty well filled it. The patio area was very small with a high fence and would really only have been suitable as a smoking area, and not as a nice place to sit outside. You always hope on these trips you're going to get a nice room but my heart sank when I walked into the room and even the bellman seemed embarassed about it. I was surprised the shampoo/conditioner etc was only replaced as it ran out - by the end of my stay I was using a sliver of soap! It would be OK to leave the part used ones, but once the originals have been opened, new items should be provided. Decent sized bottles of water in the room would have been nice too. A significant issue (to me) was that the ground floor standard rooms has all of the block's a/c units located right outside the door. When the unit for the suites was running the noise inside my room was similar to being on a plane, and it went on and off all night. The distance to and from the main building was a nuisance - it was a 10 minute walk, or you could call a shuttle but that would take 10mins to arrive. This made it very awkward if you needed to go back to your room if needed. It would have been nice, especially when there's a big conference on, to have shuttles running back and to sweeping people up as the walked in, and to have had shuttles available as we finished the day's sessions.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing location that treats you right”
Reviews.Author: Shuz5525
Reviews.Content: The property has 2 golf courses set in the beautiful Napa Valley. We loved the service, location and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Old and dated!”
Reviews.Author: skiqueen48009
Reviews.Content: Location and resort grounds are good but the accommodations are very tired and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: indiana1231
Reviews.Content: Based on the price you would think the service and accomodations would be much nicer. When we first went to check in our room was not ready so we went to the golf club for lunch and the front desk said they would call when our room was ready. We waited over 2 hours and no call. We went back to front desk and room was ready but didn't acknowledge that someone had forgotten to call us. One day our rooom was not made up. We had to call at 6:00 in the evening to have the room made up. This just wasn't the service we expected. Rooms are clean but dated. A pretty setting and decent location, but probably would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was very dissappointed. Rooms need an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Reggietravel
Reviews.Content: The minute I walked into the room I called the front desk and asked if we could check out in the morning. Room dated and horribly decorated. The golf course was nice and so was the workout facility.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Xtylynn777
Reviews.Content: We did a package that included breakfast, one dinner, and two winery tastings. One of the tastings was at Black Stallion, which I really enjoyed. We stayed in one of the rooms with a kitchenette, separate bedroom, living room, and fireplace. It was so cute, like going to your own little house. The food was very good. The location is convenient. My favorite part, however, was the spa...it was not crowded at all when I was there and the whirlpool was great. I had a great massage too. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained property”
Reviews.Author: wes482
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the previous reviewer in regards to it being a great property back in the day but now...not so much. Our room was very poorly maintained, simple things to fix were left in poor shape (ie. the door handle to the bathroom was so loose it was close to falling out of the door, etc.). The bed was fairly uncomfortable (the pillows were horrible) and the A/C struggled to keep the room temp below 80 degrees during the day. The Grill for dinner was mediocre and breakfast was very blah. The staff seemed unenthusiastic and not genuine during check-in and check-out. The bellman/valet was very helpful and went out of his way to provide good service.

Reviews.Title: “It may have been great back in the day, but now..not so much”
Reviews.Author: FirstVaca
Reviews.Content: Where to begin.....First, we scheduled a room for 3 people (1 bedroom with a pull-out couch), when we got there, it was an old, broken down room with a king bed and a couch, no pull-out. So we were moved to a 2-bedroom condo (for the increased cost) with no apologies and no help to move 1/4-mile away. And we were there for a corporate conference spending lots of money on conference rooms, receptions and the like. The concierge offered to handle a rent-a-car from Hertz in town for us, delivered to the hotel. Okay, maybe we are getting back on track here, right? Car delivered with no problem, hotel staff is very nice. I dropped the car off at the concierge for pick-up when we checked out, like I was told to do by the concierge and the Hertz representative. Well, one WEEK later, I get a call from Hertz asking if I still needed to extend the rental. WHAT? Apparently, the concierge had never called Hertz to return the car. It's. A. CAR. How do you not know that it's there? Other bad things: it took me 2 days and having to ask someone on the staff before I could find a computer to check my email. There are no signs to them. I saw one of our neighbors waiting for over an hour for the shuttle van from the condos to the main hotel. Many of our fellow conference guests complained about their "old" and "dingy" rooms. Most were unhappy about several things - the condition of the plumbing, kitchenette, etc. Our banquet meal in the main ballroom was virtually inedible (even as banquet meals go). On our "big night", I ate mashed potatoes and broccolli because the meat was horrible. We had to steal a wine bottle to get because they only poured a sliver of wine at the start of each course and never came back. Good things: the staff are very nice people. They try. The crab cake appetizer was very good at the banquet, especially with the horseradish sauce. The bartender in the lobby makes a great martini. They didn't stop us from stealing the bottles of wine to serve ourselves. The beds in the condo were ultra-comfortable. In short: NOT worth the money they charge.

Reviews.Title: “A business meeting here? Only if your standards are VERY low.”
Reviews.Author: jenniferso
Reviews.Content: We have 13 people for a 3-day business meeting -- all staying in rooms for three days. We were the "master" charge for the entire party - all the room & food charges were going to us. (I use the past tense, but I am writing this from my bed now...sleepless from my 2nd crappy day here.) The first room they put us in was terrible: tiny, dark, run-down and the musty shag carpet smelled up the room. At our request, they moved us to another room (for an additional $50, they warned) which was larger, but also very run down. "70's motel-like" is a good descriptor. The bellboy told us "I''ll try and pull some strings with my manager and get you into a better room (wink wink)." We waited... He came back and said "Sorry, my manager would only agree to an upgrade for another $75." (Remember, we've brought in 13 people here, 3 nights, mid-week....our beer budget is 10 times that!). Now late for dinner, tired of moving and the petty response for 'the manager', we declined. The bellboy then asked us to fill out an "unforgettable moments!" form for him to show to his boss. (We felt bad for the kid, and uncomfortably on the spot about it, so we filled it out.) He also seemed un-subtly angling for a big tip, which we gave him for the same reasons. The carpet in our room is old, dirty, spotted and quite tattered in placed. The bathroom is Super 8 Motel-esque with the sink in the 'hall'. We have exactly enough towels to shower, but not a single one more.The carpet is basement-like enough to warrant putting towels on it when you stand at the sink. The sheets are nice, the bed is surprisingly firm, but the rest of the bedding is worn and cheapo. We had to call for additional pillows. The 6:45 wake-up call on morning 1 was missed (luckily we'd barely slept anyway!). Annoyed, I called to make note in our record, which they said they did and called 'the manager' again. (Who is this 'manager' anyway?) When I called in the evening to MAKE SURE our wake up call morning 2 was not missed, the increasingly rude operator said "I don't see anything noted here and I wasn't here this morning - so it's not my problem." She was downright aggressive with me on the phone. Morning 2 we got a hang-up call at 6:30, a hang-up call at 6:42 and a wake-up call at yes, 6:45. In the bar night 1 someone in our party had to go back and forth to get drinks because the waitress never bothered asking us if we wanted anything else. When we asked if she could put two tables together she said with a point, "there's the table" -- she had no plans to move anything. The 13 of us sat around the one table in a circle, balancing our drinks in our laps or on the floor. Avoiding doing any work seemed to be her main priority. Our bill might have been twice as large had she only 'waitressed' a bit. Dinner at the Grill was a few notches above airplane food (and about $100 per person + 18% tip included). Our (warm-ish) champagne, which they ran out of after 1 bottle, was $80 (almost 4x retail of $24. 2x is acceptable). They also ran out of our wine after 1 bottle and the port after one glass (which they served in a cognac glass filled to the brim). The wait-staff was befuddled and inattentive....except for a finely-dressed young man who only showed up as we were walking out the door to talk about all the great wines they had there. We were the kind of group who might have ordered $2000 worth of wine had anyone paid a little attention to us at the table. The business meeting itself was...okay. The hotel was confused ahead of time, messing the plans up enough so that our travel agent voiced her concerns about it. The fees for some things were silly - like a basic projector for the small meeting @ $350 a day, which we declined. The person in charge of business meetings at the hotel rushed in once in the morning, never to be seen again. Coffee arrived on time. Lunch, unfortunately, was at the same place as dinner the evening before - same menu. The spouses avoided the in-house spa and food like the plague and instead went off-site for a day of heavy spending that could have been Silverado's had they offered anything remotely passable. If you're having a business meeting that you hope to be anything close to sophisticated or impressive, Silverado will be a disappointment. If you're traveling for personal pleasure, there are too many great places in the area to set your head down here.

Reviews.Title: “don't ever stay here...”
Reviews.Author: betsy m
Reviews.Content: To call the Silverado a "Resort" is the most misrepresentative statement ever. First of all, they are not hotel rooms at all. they're more like old apartments that have been divided up into as many rooms as possible just to maximize profit. we were nearly a mile from the main property in what appeared to be a private community of condos built sometime well before I was even born. after following the shuttle van to the "room" i said to my boyfriend "it looks like people live here...like these are apartments." at which time the bellman got out of the shuttle and approached our vehicle to tell us that this was our room and our parking spot, but the owner was parked there right now so we could just park in the parking lot across the street. we were both confused to say the least. he didn't take us to our room or take our bags, he just left us there to find our way. when we opened the door to the room i was stunned. it was so tiny i could literally reach everything except for the bathroom without leaving the bed. my bedroom at home is nearly twice as big as the entire hotel room we stayed in, including closet, bathroom and patio (which gave us a beautiful view of the back of a carport). there were four air conditioning units right outside our door, which was right under the staircase and next to the room our "landlord" was staying in (weird to say the least). it was loud, the shower wasn't clean and basically, we paid a ton of money to sleep in a small walk-in closet. i cancelled our reservations for the next night immediately, which turned out to be the one and only thing we were satisfied with the entire night - the fact that they cancelled our reservation without charging for the rest of it. we still had to pay nearly $300 for the one night which is by far, the biggest waste of money I have ever experienced.The worst part is, when we went to Calistoga and St Helena the next day, everyone we spoke to about it didn't seem surprised in the least. the website and all information the Silverado presents is a total misrepresentation of what it actually is. buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “So-so and over priced”
Reviews.Author: ARC55
Reviews.Content: Attended two conferences there. Each time I had a one BR suite on the ground floor. The hotel is like a condo set up. Each building has 4 suites and 4 singles split on two floors. The rooms I stayed in were slightly different. Both were in the low 600s room numbers and about a 15 minute walk to the clubhouse. Each room was differently decorated and with full kitchens. The main building smelled old and the rooms were run down, the bathrooms were low quality and cramped, the furnishings outside of the tv were old and worn, and the view from the low 600s was not inspiring. A golf course view would have neen nicer. At 300 a night it is not worth it. Kind of like staying in someone's condo. About a 10 minute drive to down town Napa. The Clubhouse restaurant was good for a burger but not much else. What trouble me most was the parking at your rom location. They have parking for eight cars in front of your unit. But the parking is designed so that half the cars block the other cars. I parked in first and was locked in for most of the day because the other fellow was out playing golf. Aft ht I parked in a general lot about 100 yards away. Overpriced, run down, and there are better selections.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately had 3 nights at this hotel last week as a delegate attending a conference.Arrived at 2.30 pm on the Sunday and was immediately told that check-in was from 4pm. A member of the reception staff said that he would try and 'fast track' the cleaning of my room so that it would be ready before this time. He took my number and said he would call me to let me know. Not having heard further from him i approached the reception at 4.01 pm for an update and amazingly was told that my room was now miracously ready. I was not alone in this respect as there were by now about a dozen or so other guests hanging around waiting to be allocated their rooms as well. I was eventually allocated room 618 which was right on the perimeter of the resort (about 15 minutes walk from the reception or a 5 minute drive). When I arrived at the room I found a very very tired bland room full of 1970's furnishings which should have been discarded many years ago. The view wasn't particularly inspiring either. The main road to one side and a view of the driving range. Unpacking my bag I thought I would check the wi-fi. Guess what this wasn't operating. Phoning the front desk they put me in contact with their offsite IT provider. To be fair they were pretty helpful although it was a bit surreal to be told to walk around the room with my iPad in the air to see whether I could get a signal. Anyway after wasting an hour or so with no success they suggested that I try again the following day to see whether I could get a signal. I did and I didn't! With this I phoned up the front desk and requested a room change. They said they would try to accommodate my request but the hotel was busy. Eventually I was allocated a room nearer the main hotel (5 minutes walk) but was only allowed to move in from 4.00 pm that day. The room (222) was better than the previous room I was given but when you are paying a significant daily rate plus resort charges and taxes then let's just say I was still very underwhelmed! I did now however have wi-fi so things were on the up. I spoke to a number of the other delegates attenting the conference and feedback was mixed. Some said their rooms were great, with comptempory furnishings and great views but the vast majority held my view that the rooms were just not good enough. Apparently many of the rooms rented out have owners and therefore it really is pot luck with regards to room allocation. I was originally due to stay 4 nights at this hotel but ended up just staying the 3 so that could get back to San Francisco and enjoy some comfort. I have been to a number of these conventions in the past (which are held all over the states) and I have to say that this resort hotel was the worst and most impractical place I have ever stayed at. You may have gathered i have no intention of visiting this place again whether for business or for pleasure. The only redeeming feature is the challenging golf course which is maintained to a very high standard......it's not cheap though!

Reviews.Title: “A marginal motel at best!”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: To call this place a Resort and Spa is a real stretch. Staff is pleasant. The place lacks leadership and proper management. It is marginal at best.
