To recap my complaint: No bottle of complementary water in the room at over $300.00 per night. The amenities were sub standard for a resort (and in fact were better at the Best Western in Napa). The beverages in the mini bar had expired expiration dates and were flat. No food service after 10pm. This is a Resort in the country. It is miles to town and the only thing they offer is to call a a pizza place (with a 1 ½ hour wait for delivery). The robes they provide are pathetic. They are well worn and wouldn't fit a 12 year old child. This not a Resort…it is a Motel. A very expensive 3 Star Motel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: chitravel2008
Reviews.Content: So after reading the many mixed reviews of the Silverado resort, we booked here for a 3 night stay in Sept 2011. My husband and I worked with a travel agent who has been to the property a number of times and really liked it. Once we checked in and were shown to our room (1 bedroom golf course fireplace suite), it was a HUGE disappointment. It's a condo-style with full kitchen and living room, but the green carpet, dated furniture and overall drab feel of the room was disappointing. We called the front desk and mentioned that our travel agent requested an upgraded room and that we were not happy with this one. It took over an hour for us to be moved (the resort is huge and really spread out), but we moved into the Oak Creek section room #880 and it was great! Granite countertops, very cozy, newer room with updated tile shower. But this was at least a 5 min drive to the main hotel, and was in a gated, residential section of the resort. For us it was great since we had a car and wanted to relax, but I would not recommend it if you are coming with family and want to go back/forth to the hotel and different times (they do have a shuttle but it takes time). Overall, we really enjoyed our stay, but I would give this "luxury" hotel 3 because of the major inconsistency in rooms. Also, they had a 50% off promotion for two of the weeknights we stayed, so get a deal and ask for an upgraded room!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Guest Experience!”
Reviews.Author: gkf-texas
Reviews.Content: Harvest time is always busy in Napa - and, this year was no exception. But, despite sold out conditions, we found a gem in the Director of Guest Experience at Silverado, Mr. Nikolay Tevekeliyski. He went out of his way on numerous occasions to make our trip not only comfortable, but memorable - the difference between a good trip and a great trip. The culture and the spirit he embodies is first class - thanks Nikolay and thans to Silverado!

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends Escape to Wine Country!!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie17
Reviews.Content: My besties (4 of us) - friends for 25 + years .. meet up in Napa to celebrate a milestone birthday. No husbands - no kids ! Rented a condo located within The Silverado Resort. Accomidations wonderful - service - wonderful .. would we go back ?- YES !!! AND.. we are already planning another trip for 2012!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hertsrider
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first 5 nights of our honeymoon. When we arrived after travelling for the best part of 20hrs from the UK we were greeted by a very polite doorman who told us to leave the car where it was and go check in. At the front desk I was greeted by Rose I think it was, who was really nice; I explained that it was our honeymoon when she asked what the occassion was, and she apologised that she would be unable to upgrade us, but gave us loads of great coupons to get free wine tastings at some of the higher class wineries. Once we had checked in we got back into the car and drove round to where our cottage was, it wasn't far, and easily walkable, but if you don't fancy walking then call the reception and they'll send one of the staff round in the golf cart, expect to pay gratuity though. The room was lovely, spacious enough with plenty of storage, and a nice shower/bath combo. The minibar was very full of drinks and snacks which are extortionate as ever, but I just took these out (this isn't a weight sensitive one thankfully) and put our drinks and snacks in instead, just swapping them when we left. The room had air conditioning as you'd expect, but it is a little loud for people who aren't used to it so we switched it off at night, but that's not a problem really as it was plenty cool enough at night. We ate at the bar the first night, just a burger and fries; well I say just a burger and fries, it was absolutely delicious! They bar staff are really friendly and attentive, we felt right at home straight away. The only other time we ate there was at the grill restaurant. Again this was very good, with an excellent front of house host called Matt, and the waiter was also very good. The food was pretty good, I had a lovely steak, and my wife had fried chicken, which she said was a little greasy but still enjoyed. It was fairly expensive again though, as you would expect really. They also have a gourmet restaurant, but we didn't try it. Overall I think I would stay there again, it had a lovely atmosphere, and was generally very comfortable. The walls are a little thin in the cottages though, and you can hear people if they are a little noisy, but this didn't really affect us. It is a great base for exploring the wider area, we had a car and took advantage of it travelling away from Napa, and the main routes were very easily accessed. I can highly recommend Lake Berryessa for scenery and if you want a paddle. The town is a $15 cab ride away. I also hightly recommend the Del Dotto wine caves tour which is just down the road from Silverado, it's a very unique tour with fabulous wine and a really good host team, especially a chap named Ryan. To conclude I would say ignore all the complaints about it being outdated, it is perfectly good for a stay in the wine country!

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet grounds, excellent service but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: worldtravellerruth11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two days at the resort with other Board Members. The grounds are great and sprawling, but some of the rooms could be as far away as ¼ mile from the main building and definitely need updating. They have golf carts to take you around the resort if you don't want to walk. There are several well kept pools, tennis courts, and nicely maintained garden areas throughout the complex. The staff is friendly and helpful. The bar area was nice with two levels; the lower level had a great two piece jazz band playing, it was wonderful to listen to while being able to carry on a conversation. The rooms definitely need refurbishing in several ways. First, my carpet was old and a bit stained around the sink area. It seems that they installed new tile in the bathroom, but kept the old Formica type counters at the sink instead of upgrading to granite. Also, they used the old fashioned actual key rather than the electronic key card entry which is more secure. The king size bed was comfortable and had good quality bedding. It was nice that each room had a little patio area with table and chairs most were open to the outside walkways but some had enclosed areas. The buildings are very low density and mostly one story with only a few buildings that were two stories. It's very quiet and peaceful. The resort is near to a lot of activities in the Napa valley. If you want a quiet get away, in a resort with beautiful grounds and don't mind outdated rooms this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “lumpy pillows”
Reviews.Author: tinsley a
Reviews.Content: We only had enough time to spend 1 night at this resort. It was truly beautiful, and service was excellent, although I wished we had another night here, I was kind of happy to get out of the humid room with lumpy pillows and go to another hotel were I could actually sleep better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: carlo45
Reviews.Content: After I booked, I read the reviews and while generally very positive there were some harsh negative reviews. What's going on? I needed this place to be good since I was bringing the wife to Napa for our 28th. Everything turned out wonderful. Here's what I did and didn't find in the written reviews. Some people say dated and dirty carpet. Huh? The place is physically beautiful. It wasn't built yesterday but I only saw modern clean furnishings. Our room probably began as a 2 BR condo split in half and we had the slider entrance which some people have complained about. The slider didn't bother us and the room was spacious with new bedding and well furnished. We walked both golf courses and any golfer would want to play here, especially in the early cool evening. Highlights include beautiful mountain views in the main hall where you can enjoy your coffee in the morning. Another highlight was the main restaurant called the Grill with the friendliest staff. The heirloom salad with the fresh mozzarella was the best we had at any of the many resorts we stayed during our vacation. The Kobe hamburger was the best hamburger I've ever eaten. Same for the fish tacos. A downside that has been mentioned in some of the reviews is the shortage of staffing. One of the most beautiful resort pools but there should be staff taking drink and food orders and this was missing. The concierge was terrific every morning but not sure there was somebody around in the evening. We checked in a little before 4 and they were still getting the room ready and I think that is probably because they're short on maid staffing. I read a critique of the location. That's ridiculous. It's a few minutes from the main road in the heart of Napa. Can't get better than that. There were complaints about the rooms being spread out but all resorts are like that and I prefer that setup to a big huge apt building with noisy neighbors. The privacy was great and our room was a 2 minute walk to dining, pool and main hall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Getaway”
Reviews.Author: tomj675
Reviews.Content: This resort was really excellent. We arrived before the official check-in time but were greeted by the new front desk manager and he made the experience so nice. Rather than reminding us that the "check-in time is not until 4:00" he apologized that our room was not quite ready, but that we would love it when it was. He then escorted us to the lunch restaurant and introduced us to the Host and asked that we be given a table with a wonderful view. As soon as we were seated, the server came to us and said the manager would like to buy us a glass of wine or champaign. What a nice touch....he didn't need to do that at all since we were very early in our arrival. After lunch, he found us sitting on the veranda and brought us discount coupons for the spa and then escorted us to the spa, again introduced us to the spa manager and told them to call the front desk after our massages so that we could get a golf cart ride back to the front desk. After our massages, our room was ready and it was one of the standard rooms, but just beautiful. Very fresh and clean with ice already in the ice bucket. Wonderful soaps and cosmetic ammenities and free WIFI. I can't think of anything negative to say other than it would have been nice to have been able to park closer to our room, but this is the kind of resort that is very spread out around the golf course so that was not possible. However, they have multiple pools around the property and also guest laundry facilities that are very convenient to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort, Spa”
Reviews.Author: Lora719
Reviews.Content: Rented 2 bedroom condo on golf course for a week. Was a great place to enjoy (wonderful restaurant, fantastic spa, wine tastings, beautiful grounds, etc.) and great place to call vacation-central because of great location. As a disabled traveler, staff was attentive and helpful without being overbearing. Have great golf cart shuttle from/to resort/condo, valet parking, handicapped condo with walk in shower, lots of room. When we left, staff mailed some of our goodies home. Condo was tastefully decorated, had all the furnishings and household items (including logs for the fire) needed. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SharonOKC
Reviews.Content: We met a large group of friends in Napa Valley, just for fun. The resort had different types of rooms, some with kitchenettes and fireplaces, in which some of our friends stayed. My husband and I stayed in a single room that was clean and comfortable, but nothing fancy. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was a great location for visiting wineries, the farmer's market, and it has a golf course that my husband enjoyed. There was also a spa across the street. The resort was large, but the staff would give you rides in golf carts to the spa or different parts of the hotel grounds. We enjoyed our stay and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: bv29
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Priceline's Name your own Price, so when I learned the name of the hotel, and read the reviews on here, I was more than a bit sceptic. However, I didn't have any trouble with this place, it doesn't bother me that I have no front door, only a sliding door. The internet was fine, the grounds are so pretty and well kept. Staff members were nice and helpful, except for the young ones at the pool, for which it was clearly just a summer job. We requested a two bed room, which we got. We actually requested to stay another night, but they said they were fully booked for the next night, due to some conference that took place. We ordered room service: It took very long to be delivered, more than an hour, and I can't say it was particularly good, will probably not do it again. I didn't try the spa, which seemed a little expensive. The swimming pool was fine, as I was one of very few at 18:00 and again at 9:00 to make use of it. Inside the rooms, the carpet wasn't filthy, the bedding was fine, the amenities were very nice. Yes, you have to park your car a little way off, but it's not that far, especially if you're only staying one or two nights. They have golf carts to help you, should you need it. I would rate the experience as 3.5 stars and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and feeling pampered in the Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: jnbeach
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for four days at the Silverado Resort and Spa and found it to be a place we would recommend to others and return to. The staff were very accomodating and friendly and the food delicious. After asking for a room with two beds instead of one, they attempted to put us into probably the worst room in the complex. But when we said it wasn't acceptable, they upgraded us to a suite, and we were extremely comfortable and appreciated their efforts to give us what we needed. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: jazzfan647
Reviews.Content: The place is "tired." And the service was fairly non-existent. The concierge was given 2+ weeks to set up wine tours. When we arrived, we still had no itinerary. And the concierge was gone for the day. Their excuse: "we used to have 9 on the concierge staff; now we have 2." Restaurant staff was polite but unequal. We had prompt breakfast service but slow dinner service. When we pulled into the drive, we were directed to park nearby, check in, and then they would help us to the room. Upon check in, no help was to be found with our luggage. Just a guy with a map who pointed us in the right direction... FInally, the laundry facility had a sign that read, "detergent can be purchased in sundries shop." So my husband left for the morning, I go to pick up detergent and there is NO detergent. (The day before they were also out of advil.) So off to Napa to find a walmart for laundry soap. (I normally wouldn't do laundry on vacation but we continue to half moon bay after this weekend.) Highlight of the trip was my time at the spa. Jennifer did a great facial and had great recommendations around town.

Reviews.Title: “Condo set up,no central air, carpet filthy”
Reviews.Author: housecalls
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a room with no central air,filthy carpet and extremely noisy this is the place for you. I have traveled all over and would never recommend this place to anyone. Not even close to a four star resort. Horrible experience! :(

Reviews.Title: “Golf too pricey...staff nothing but kids”
Reviews.Author: Raj S
Reviews.Content: Resort was pretty, kind of outdated, but clean and nice. My husband was annoyed with the young kids in the cart area and golf shop as they seemed to be having their private conversations and not really concerned about the customer. Been golfing here for years, and now it's suddenly private?????????Wth? Thank goodness for George in the golf shop, who goes out of his way to make sure every customer is well taken care of when staying there and playing golf. Glad he is there to take care of us every year!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for wine tasting in Napa”
Reviews.Author: Grimhand
Reviews.Content: Some of the earlier negative reviews had made me a little nervous, but our experience at the Silverado was great and I would stay here again. From the moment George the bell cap rescued our jet-lagged behinds at check-in until the moment we left the facility we were very happy. We had a one bedroom with full kitchen and a little fireplace (#480). This unit appeared to have been redone as most everything seemed updated (e.g., flat screens). However these are still older facilities and will never pass for a new build. We found the grounds lovely and well maintained but, yes, you might get leaf blowers early in the morning - the price of being ground floor. We ate in both the restaurants and found them very good. Sami, especially, in the Oak made our anniversary very special. Neither restaurant is cheap, but having a full kitchen expands one's options. Our small patio hosted many happy hours with cheese, crackers, and bread from local markets - and you will be buying wine from most of your tastings. It was just a great time. Shout outs to George and Sami, but really the entire staff was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “How Far It Has Fallen”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer1974
Reviews.Content: Our first two trips to the Silverado were very enjoyable. However, on this third consecutive annual visit, we came away feeling like the resort had changed signficantly, and not in a good way. In general, the attitude of the staff was "everything is on our schedule....that's how it is." The importance of building that schedule around customer needs and expectations has been lost at Silverado. Perhaps it is a sign of difficult economic times, but the Silverado also appears to be doing everything possible to extract every last dime from anyone willing to spend it, even if the quality of the guest experience suffers as a result. For example, they charge $130 per person for a round of golf....the courses are beautiful, and ordinarily, I would say worth the price....but it took over five hours to play over the weekend, and they actually had a wedding ceremony being performed on the course during playing hours, complete with amplification and music....not the kind of golfing experience we were seeking. During our stay, I actually called and asked to speak to a manager. When I spoke to this person, and shared the many disappointments of our stay (poor food quality, room type assigned to us was not as promised, pathetic Internet connectivity, terrible golfing experience, indifferent staff attitude), I was thanked for my feedback and that was that. The Napa Valley is a wonderful place for recreation and/or relaxation. No need to endure the high prices and disappointing experience at Silverado Resort. There are simply too many other options available to visitors seeking to get the most out of vacation time and investment.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: yoghurtland
Reviews.Content: This family style resort has decent sized rooms with friendly services. Every staff we met were really polite and keen to help. We stayed in a two bedrooms house, it had all the basic kitchenette, even though the style of the rooms were not modern, it was clean and decent

Reviews.Title: “Good for Golf and Tennis”
Reviews.Author: Jvu4
Reviews.Content: Spent two days on business trip. The room that we got is like a two-bed room apt in Oak creek area. It means that 10 minutes DRIVE to the main hotel and restaurant. The resort is big: two 18-hole golf courses. Therefore, you must be careful to reserve your room. If you don't want to drive back and forth, then specify to stay within walking distance to the main hall. Where we stayed, there are swimming pool and tennis courts. It was quiet as compared to the main pool. It's a nice place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: sdtaz
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here for a business meeting. A beautiful property! The room, while perhaps on the small side, was plenty big enough. The room was like a small studio with no kitchen...I even had my own gated, enclosed patio. It was a great location for visiting some of the vineyards!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location. Great service”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi04NZ
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the facilities and service from checkin staff. Today is one of their busiest days of the year yet they were super friendly and efficient. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: FWL5346
Reviews.Content: The Silverado has very nice rooms with a staff to help you and your family get settled. They will show you where your room is, help with bags and if you need a ride to dinner they will come and get you. The Spa worked well for my wife, massage,pampering, and just a well deserved & relaxing afternoon. I enjoyed the North golf course, greens and fairways manicured, sand soft and fluffy made for an enjoyable day on the course. I hadn't played here before and was happy that I caught up with a couple of locals that were more than happy to help show me the course, even a little local knowledge on a couple of greens. The restaurant in the club house has a wonderful wait staff and Exec Chef Jake makes a dinner to remember, prices were very reasonable. An easy drive to see the Napa Valley wine country.

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely fabulous! Greatest place for a family to stay!"”
Reviews.Author: geoff C
Reviews.Content: Great golf and tennis and great tennis and golf camps for the kids. The pools are a ton of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay in the silverado!”
Reviews.Author: QTravelMayo_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last few days of our honeymoon and we really enjoyed it. We had read some of the reviews that the rooms were old fashioned but our room was really nice and had a lot of extras such as a fridge, hob etc. Sergio on reception looked after us well and we appreciated it!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing new ownership and changes at Silverado Resort - GO THERE!”
Reviews.Author: monica s
Reviews.Content: We are BIG fans of Silverado Resort and Spa for many years but recently it has taken on a new ownership group and they are shaking it up to be a world class destination. The new GM is a pro at what he does, one of the two golf courses has been completely re-designed so there will be major tournaments knocking at their door and the spa is just better than EVER! I think they are hard at work to upgrade every single room in the place so they will all be as the nice as the room we just stayed in. Ask for an upgraded room when booking. The food is delicious and the Grill is always a constant good meal whenever you are hungry. Just the quintessential Napa Valley resorts...it doesn't get more destination than this for your family trip or wedding or just the weekend get away from S.F. (like we do from the East Bay)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Selbub
Reviews.Content: Dated facility and overpriced for value received. Friends who golfed said it was a really nice golf course. Room not ready at check-in, after 6 pm. Not worh a return trip

Reviews.Title: “What a great resort!!”
Reviews.Author: swlb
Reviews.Content: It was just pristine. The service was wonderful. Our room(condo) was just perfect. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: FlyboyinLondon
Reviews.Content: Golf here was fantastic and staff at the course made you feel welcome. It's expensive to play but course is immaculate. The hotel side is spread out and in need of renovations. Our room lke a cave. Small and dark and when I asked front desk for a different room I was quoted the rate card.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: sexyindyms
Reviews.Content: Thus place is beautiful and worth every cent! The staff is professional and prompt. There concierge service even made our dinner reservations for us. We celebrated a friends birthday and they provided a complimentary bottle of Champaign and signed card from the staff at dinner in the resort resturant.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay here. Always excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Californianative123
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this resort before with photos, so I won't post any more photos, but I recently stayed here again. It is just an excellent place. To address people who state that it's not "luxurious", I would argue that the place is pretty darn good. It is an older hotel, but it has been immacuately maintained. The bed, sheets, linens, and furniture are all outstanding. It was built in a different era, so it may not be as modern as some other hotels, but it is still quite excellent. I was very happy with it. It is always clean and the service is excellent. The rooms are little "bungalows" or "condos", so it does not hat the central elevator hotel format that other hotels have. But it is an excellent place to be, and I think it's solid, reliable, and consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - This is not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed52024
Reviews.Content: For a "luxury" resort we found the accomodations worn and in need of a serious upgrade. The resort looks "tired." Originally we had booked a 3 bedroom suite, but found ourselves in a house/condo 2 miles from the main resort. Since we were on vacation, and we had only one car, this was extremely inconvenient for the family to enjoy the amenities of the resort. We were moved to a two bedroom suite on the main resort, which was better, but we had lost one day of three on our vacation. Furnishings in the new suite were seriously outdated. Bathrooms were not clean--hair on the floors, in the showers, and dirt/dust on the counters. The evening cleaning staff had to come re-clean our unit before we could actually use it. Grounds were pretty, but apparently require much maintanence, as we experienced weed whackers, lawn mowers, and blowers outside our unit at 7AM every morning. We will say that the pools, fitness center, and tennis courts were very nice. The staff was professional, except for one golf course marshall. We had asked for directions to the basketball court and were told by some of the course marshals to walk along the 18th hole. As we did this we were approached by a different marshall in a cart who proceed to yell at us that we were walking along the golf course. When we told him we were looking for the court he told us in no uncertain terms that we had better go straight to the court and no where else! Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let a few bad reviews scare you, this place was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: PhilandJodie
Reviews.Content: I feel this hotel has unjustly received many bad reviews. My experience at this place was top notch. My wife and I enjoyed Silverado Resort so much that we extended our stay for two days instead of going back to san Fran. The hotel honoured our priceline rate for the additional two days even though the posted rate was much higher since the additional days were Friday and Saturday nights. Bring your clubs!! The North course is fantastic (the south looks great too) and a bargain at twilight for $60. Apparently a group led by Johnny Miller has purchased this resort. It had great looking tennis courts as well and lots of them with what appeared to be free instruction. The grounds surrounding this resort are impeccably groomed and give you a nice laid back feeling. This would be a great place to do a vacation with another couple. You can all go wine tasting during the day or the boys can golf while the ladies go to the spa, which mine said was outstanding. We went cheap and had the basic hotel room which was essentially the 2nd bedroom of the two bedroom suites that they rent, separated by a locked door. It might have been noisy had someone else been staying in the other side of the suite who was not considerate but we didn't have that problem as the space next to us was empty. We ate at the restaurant more times than we expected to because it was so good and also because it was convenient as it was a bit of a drive into Napa. The front desk staff gave us a complimentary drink upon our check in and were always very friendly and accommodating. Our server at Breakfast was excellent (as were all servers) and gave us many good recommendations for wineries to visit as well. See below. The hotel was located perfectly for us as we did not have to fight the traffic of Napa everyday. It made the entire trip seem very "countryesque" as were were very rarely in a city setting. Our trip was all about the wineries and wine tastings (23 winery tastings in 4.5 days!!). The hotel is situated just off the Silverado Trail giving very short trips to many excellent wineries. Just head north on Silverado Trail and start tasting. Natalie at Reynolds Family Winery, the gang at Robert Sinski, mustache dude at Whitehall Lane Winery and Kelvin at Domaine Carneros were some of our favourites and all no more than a 15-20 minute drive away (ask them about the couple from Canada that were "power tasting" back in July). Darioush winery was impressive to look at but too pretentious for us. Avoid it. Another few minutes up the Silverado Trail are the wineries of the famed Stag's Leap district. Many other famous wineries such as Caymus, Opus One and Chateau Monteline are just a short drive further over towards St. Helena. Definitely avoid driving through St. Helena on the weekends as traffic can get very busy and frustrating. Jump over to Silverado Trail to avoid the crowds. We would stay at Silverado Resort again in a heartbeat. Those who knocked this resort are likely the ones who will never be satisfied no matter what or the ones who have unrealistic expectations. Remember, those who did not enjoy their stay are way more likely to post a review than those who enjoyed. Don’t be scared off by the reviews of this place. To save $$, bring own wine to dinner and pay the corkage, not just at this place but all restaurants. Book your golf at the twighlight rate and save mucho $$. Bring your clubs as they do not discount the club rentals as much as they discount the green fees for twilight.

Reviews.Title: “Scenic, quiet, not far from Yountville either”
Reviews.Author: maverick_cp
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a locked off single king room. Quiet, clean, comfortable, neutral and seemingly for the more subdued client. That said it's in a great location especially if you want to go for a nice bike ride (we rented pedal assisted bikes from a change of greenery - best bike ride ever!!!) William Hill winery is within walking distance - visit for the outdoor seating and view alone. If I was hosting a large event, I would do it here. It's very well suited and they are very well staffed and organized to support it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding as always”
Reviews.Author: Surf61
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Silverado Resort for ten years every July. There is 16-20 of us depending on the year. We stay for a full week. We relax play golf and enjoy the resort. This years trip was one of the best ever. There has been many improvements made to the resort. The room product has been upgraded and the golf courses have been enhanced. The staff is outstanding. From the front desk, housekeeping, pro shop and the restaurants. The Silverado staff makes us feel like family. Dolce is running the hotel and Troon is running the golf. If you want a first class experience come to this resort. We have friends that fly in from Japan, NYC and Atlanta. Silverado is simply the best !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in a California Cottage”
Reviews.Author: hawkdss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an amazing stay here. Great location near the Silverado Trail and numerous wineries. The room was huge, recently renovated, and had a total California cottage vibe. There was a fireplace, a private patio, and a functional kitchen. I can't believe that there are any bad reviews on this place. We had a great night away. Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Rick-Rozzi
Reviews.Content: Back in December, we decided that this summer we wanted to vacation in Napa. Being a believer in Trip Advisor reviews, I used the reviews to help make my decision on where to stay. I was also particpating in a Half Marathon Run during the stay and I wanted to golf and have a gym facility. Most reviews I read were excellent, with a some negatives on the rooms and cost. I decided to ignore most of the infrequent negative reviews and trust the majority of positive reviews. I am glad I did. Our vacations was spectacular and we loved this resort. It is a resort and not a cramped hotel. we had a lovely one bedroom 250 square feet (smallest at resort) but bigger than a typical hotel room. Room was very clean and spacious. I was concerned of the negative reviews of the rooms being outdated, but I thought they were as updated as many of hotels I have stayed in recently. We stayed in what appeared to be condo unit, which we loved. We had covered parking, a balcony, daily maid service and acces to the gym, swimming pool, hot tub, tennis, golf and walking, jogging and bike trails. I played golf for three days on some of the most majestic golf courses you will ever see. Me and my wife used the the Gym everyday. What we paid for our room per night ,during peak season in Napa Valley, I felt was very reasonable. We loved our stay here an would make this our first choice if we come back. FYI. The Silverado Resort is located in a very upscale neighborhood of Napa, with many very beautiful homes surronding the resort and golf course and I can see why

Reviews.Title: “We are golfers and we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jim32062
Reviews.Content: The Royal Oak restaurant was one of the best steakhouses ever. The wine was fantastic. Golf on the newly renovated North Course was like Augusta National. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property.”
Reviews.Author: rednrob
Reviews.Content: We had several issues with our rooms not being available on time. Brandon Fonger at the front desk went over and above to work with our group. He consistently checked in with us to make things better andresearched some last minute requests for us. Excellent service on everyhing except checkout. Stephanie miller was our group contact and she was also fabulous!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Golf courses great, hotel not so”
Reviews.Author: EmilyJones
Reviews.Content: It has always seemed a shame that a hotel in such a prime location in the Napa Valley doesn't have better rooms and service. Johnny Miller is trying to upgrade the resort, but only the golf courses are up to par. Our room was very small and ordinary, the service was nothing special, and the food in the casual restaurant was certainly not what you would expect in such a world class area. Someday I hope that this can be corrected!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed At!”
Reviews.Author: bdegroodt
Reviews.Content: In the last 4 years I've spent over 1 year in a hotel room of some sort, so I feel qualified to give an opinion on the quality of Silverado Resort. I can honestly say this is the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in. I'm generally a Westin, Hilton, Marriott or boutique hotel or resort. So some of the resources not available at Siverado are completely forgiven by me as I understand they are smaller than some operators. That said, if I was broke and going to be homeless the day after my stay at Siverado, I'd expect my last night in a hotel to be about as bad as this place. First, the room wasn't on the main property. It required leaving the resort, driving down the road, past the golf course and into an apartment complex with a carport. Parking was unclear. It's tandem and I didn't feel like blocking someone in and getting a call in the middle of the night to move my car, so I parked in someone's spot hoping I wouldn't get towed. The car port was the kind you see in old apartment complexes. Nice patch of oil and dirt in the spots. The room was small (and I mean smaller than NY rooms). So small I couldn't walk around one side of the bed and at the end of the bed was a giant air conditioner sticking out of the wall. No, not a TV, that was jammed down in a cabinet beneath the height of the bed. Mid-pile shag carpet was everywhere. Including part of the bathroom. Seriously? Who puts carpet in the bathroom anymore? Oh and the over-scented perfume they used to try to cover up who-knows-what-mess was enough to almost cause me to vomit. Bedding was cheap polyester. You know the kind. Like a Motel 6 (though I have stayed at nicer Motel 6 rooms). I should have known something was wrong when I checked in. The frontdesk girl left without saying where she was going for about 10 minutes. When she returned she muttered something about trying to find a better room for me and that I wasn't getting what I ordered. Once I got to the room I immediately called to find out what the heck was going on because I was in an absolute dump. Especially at nearly $300 for a night. I don't have any enemies that I'm aware of, but if I did, I couldn't possibly tell them to stay here. Do yourself a favor and do not stay at this place. While the pretty images of the mansion and the golf course may fool you, you'll have to put your head down at the end of the night in the room and I can assure you you'll feel completely fleeced for having done so. Especially now that you've been warned. Oh and the pillows? My girlfriend woke up the next morning with a bruised back of here head from the quickcrete-soft pillows. I have no idea what was in these things, but they weren't soft! Oh and one more thing--there's a resort fee for internet and parking and some portion of the spa facilities. While not unusual, a fee of this size for this dump just feels like insult to injury.

Reviews.Title: “hard to beat in Napa without spending a lot more money”
Reviews.Author: JunkyardWisdom
Reviews.Content: This is a large resort, so don't compare it to B&B's or boutique hotels. For such a large property it is relatively compact, the staff is well trained, and the service is very good. Enjoyed the restaurants, and the location made it easy to visit other places. We had a small staff retreat and the meeting rooms were great.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Style living for affordable prices in the Napa Area”
Reviews.Author: Csuris
Reviews.Content: The Silverado is an excellent hotel to stay atin the Napa region not only for it's proximity to many a great vineyard to visit but also for it's amenities and the staff. Rooms range from the standard fare of queen and king deluxe to apartment style lodging which is great if you travel with other couples or family and want to make use of the great Napa wines and food and entertain in your room. Ours was a deluxe junior suite with fireplace. AMAZING. The staff is beyond friendly and helpful available at all hours for anything one needs. Golf course and grounds are gorgeous. Next time I go to Napa, the Silverado will be my pick once more

Reviews.Title: “The Silverado was wonderful, it will be an annual event!”
Reviews.Author: julielandry
Reviews.Content: Four girlfriends and I visited the Silverado for three nights to celebrate a very special birthday. The Silverado went out of their way to make it very special. Joe, the manager and Jaylee both went out of their way to make this a wonderful weekend. The rooms were spacious, location great, amenities were wonderful. this was my first trip to Napa, now it's unanimous we'll make it an annual event to stay at the Silverado!

Reviews.Title: “Great girls trip”
Reviews.Author: kathyk61
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group of girls to vist Napa. I found the accomodations very large, comfortable beds and extremely friendly and helpful staff. The Spa pool was great! Jaylene was particularly helpful and friendly as was Joe, the manager. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, views are superb, staff helpful, no personal touch”
Reviews.Author: Janenie
Reviews.Content: Location and views are very good, staff very helpful. However, a total lack of response to a personal request let's the place down, disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “am here sitting on my balcony , loving it , highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: torontotrips
Reviews.Content: having read mixed reviews , decided to call in and see the rooms/resort before booking , the satff are very friendly , grounds beautiful , room delightful and amazing value compared to other places we have stayed in the area .It's not quite the fairmont , but definatley has its charms and we are paying about 30% of what we paid at fairmont. Check out the deals , the food voucher packages are excellent as there are great entress for under $20 . so a $50 voucher will pay a big chunk of your dinner / lunch. I am not a golfer butteh courses look beautiful. We are staying in a junior fireplace suite but the guestrooms look really good too . Rooms are either on ground floor or second floor with balcony looking onto lush gardens.....I am writing this whilst logged in to free wireless ....birds singing....i say give this place a try and ignore the bad reviews.....I think they must have been having a bad day ! the pool is quite big but full of playing kids but arent they all in summer holidays ?

Reviews.Title: “I'd do it again”
Reviews.Author: Sbbennett
Reviews.Content: We booked the Silverado Resort for 3 nights. Workout facility and pools are excellent. The staff here is friendly and helpful. They take time out of their daily tasks to guarantee you're well taken care of. The property and rooms are dated however they are extremely well kept. I would definitely book again. With all there is to do in and around Napa, we are spending just a few hours in our room each day. If you plan to spend extended hours in your room, book a suite. The king room is adequate for a young couple but not roomie.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing birthday trip to Napa...thanks to Silverado Hotel and Resort”
Reviews.Author: CarribeanJen
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that like you, I was highly skeptical of booking this hotel due to a few reviews I had read on tripadvisor. But let me assure that the staff, service, and the room at Silverado literally made the trip. I'm usually a fan of the W/Starwood Hotel's, but I felt the Silverado was certainly a place I would return to in a heartbeat. Plus, the ambiance is elegant and the landscape and views- stunning! My husband decided to surprise me by planning a trip for us and our good friends to Napa for my 32nd brithday. We booked the Silverado one night before our stay and ended up staying here by default since everything else was booked solid. We arrived at 10 a.m. and headed out via Napa Winery Shuttle (call Norm- he's got the best deal around) who picked us up in front of Silverado. We literally jumped right out of the car and into the wine tour bus and never had the chance to check-in. After six fantastic wineries and perhaps too much fun, we landed back at SIlverado only to realize I had left my purse at a winery 30 mins away! A staff member (Bryan the bartender) overhead my sob story, and how I needed to get a cab to get to my purse ASAP, and had another member of the staff drive my husband to get the purse. Upon returning, we and our friends checked in with the front desk and learned we had been upgraded to a one bedroom suite. We were really well taken care of throughout our stay which was really nice. Now the room. It was so beautiful. We had a view of the golf course and the rolling hills, and a full living room, fireplace, and kitchen, we also had an enormous deck that spanned from the living room to the bedroom overlooking the gorgeous green course. It was absolutely perfect and very romantic. The next time I stay in Napa, I'm definitely returning to SIlverado. I would have loved to have eaten at the Silverado restaurant which looked quite upscale and also had lovely views. Perhaps next time. On this trip, we drank way too much wine and ended up ordering pizza at 11:00 p.m. that was delivered to our suite (SIlverado connects you directly to the pizza place!!). Favorite winery of the day - Hagafen (a kosher vineyard with a nice outdoor patio, very casual and great wine!!). Vissatui- way too crowded and crazy. Rubicon (AKA Coppola) had lovely views and a nice space outside to sit. Andretti- great staff who took excellent care of us! Domain Chandon was our last stop and it was a lot of fun- very hip and modern with tons of great artwork for sale.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like the noise of air conditioners!”
Reviews.Author: abr02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night whilst having a quick stop in the Napa Valley. First room we were checked into had an air conditioner in the wall that sounded like a helicopter at idle, when we went out for dinner we asked if it could be looked at whilst we were out. When we got back we found they had quietened it down by totally disabling it. There was also the larger aircon plant for the rest of the building at the back of each block with was also really loud and kept switching on/off every 30 mins or so. As such at 11pm at night they moved us to another room, this one was quite a drive on the other side of the "resort" and had 2 very large air conditioners right out side the door which we were assured would be quieter when we were in the room and would run constantly rather than clunking on and off. As it turns out this was rubbish, they were very loud and we couldn't turn on our own unit as it was even louder than in the first room to the point of making the wall panels rattle. We eventually got them to shut down the outdoor units in the early hours of the morning and managed to get about 2 hours of broken very hot uncomfortable sleep before the sun rising woke us up since none of the rooms apparently have decent curtains. Both of the rooms they put us in were the second bedrooms of larger units so booking a 1/2br apartment might get you a better experience but frankly I wouldn't count on it. All in all the only positives were they refunded the cost of our stay and the swimming pools are quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: lets_vacay
Reviews.Content: Went here for my bday with my girlfriends. We purchased a spa package - 4 GF getaway for $200/person. It included a 1 night stay in a 2 bedroom fireplace suite, 50 minute massage and full use of amenities, view of the golf course. Beautiful sweet-cozy and relaxing. the only problem was TV and internet had bad reception due to a storm that day and the lights went out a few times but the generator kicked in right away. The spa was lovely - very clean and pleasant. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty grounds, but rooms and service is as far as you can get from a 4-stars”
Reviews.Author: hokiejonp
Reviews.Content: Priceline has always been good with star rankings but the Silverado may have got some folks fooled. We checked in and were given a key to our room and were then taken by golf cart to the room. Upon opening the door and walking in it was obvious the room was in use. The bed was unmade, luggage was open, lingerie was on the floor. We didn't stay long enough to see who was in the bathroom. We were brought back to the lobby where we were treated as if WE made the mistake. There was even a shrewd comment about us being a priceline reservation. We waited 30 min and were shuttled off to a new room on opposite side of the hotel - which is a wide grassy campus around golf holes (nevermind that our car was still at the other end at our original room). There was never an apology or acknowledgement of the inconvenience. The room felt as if it was a 1980 condo in Ft Lauderdale - one even enters via sliding glass doors - and simply didn't seem up to 4 star snuff. To make it all the worse, it was my honeymoon and I was embarrassed my bride had to endure all of this. Taking this hotel off the priceline map would NOT be a bad thing. Nice icing on the cake was the $20 resort fee per day tacked on to the property - we left after one night.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to wine country with teens”
Reviews.Author: Travel_diA
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay with our two teens traveling with us to Napa Valley so we needed two rooms. I had a hard time finding accommodations with 2 double or Queens in a room and I eventually booked the Silverado although we still ended up with two king bedrooms. This was economically a good place for us, we had plenty of room here, but if I were not with my teens, I would not have liked it. Here's my issue, this place is not so much as a 'resort' as it is an old condominium complex. 'Guest services' is merely rental management. Our rooms were decorated in outdated extremely cheap 'rental unit' stuff, with old icky carpet. It suited our purpose this trip, but when I go back to Napa, it will be sans kids and I'll stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Showing some signs of aging”
Reviews.Author: scotchandice
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. Our room was nice (kinda dated) but was clean and well kept. The room had an AC unit mounted in the wall that was rather loud and had to basically run 24 hours to keep it cool. The noise was a major distraction for my wife but not so much for me. The Grill had some very good food and was a nice looking room. The tuna tartar appitizer was one of the best things I have tasted in a long time. We played a round of golf on the North course and found it to be a rather challenging track for a resort. It was in very nice condition but they were having some sort of tournament there there starting two days later so I am sure they were keepping after the upkeep. Other than the front desk clerk when we checked in (who was pleasant but seemed somewhat clueless) the staff we interacted with were all professional, polite and tried to make sure everything was right for us. Over all it was a pleasant stay but the facility is showing some signs of age particularly in the guest room areas.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property ... unfortunately a bit dated! And terrible internet!”
Reviews.Author: bojantercon
Reviews.Content: Where do I start with this place?! The Silverado Resort has a very long and illustrious history, dating back to 1870. It's set on 1,200 gorgeous acres which today includes golf courses, multiple tennis courses, swimming pools and a lot of bungalows. Matter of fact, the 80's TV show Falcon Crest was shot here. Unfortunately, not much has changed since then. The grounds are gorgeous, no doubt about it. And the suites very large, yet the design is a bit 50's dated. It would not take much to turn this whole property into a grand hotel … but a renovation is definitely due. Don't take me wrong though, it's not shabby … just dated in style. However, there is no excuse for the terrible internet connection they have here. We had to move rooms for our internet barely worked. Unfortunately, that didn't really help. Given that the wifi system is outsourced to Nomadix (I’ve had problems with them in other resorts as well), the hotel was really unable to help. And when they forwarded you to the service provider you got asked stupid questions such as 'do you have 4 bars on your wifi signal?', or even worse 'sir, have you tried restarting your computer?!' Compounding the problem, the AT&T 3G connection here is also disastrous! Barely worked and could barely catch a signal. So if you need to stay connected, I would consider twice before staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: Grammy001
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. Upgraded our room to a junior suite in honor of our 35th anniversary and sent us a bottle of champaign. Very quiet. Spa services were excellent. Off the beaten path but still convenient to both Sonoma and Napa Valley. We definitely recommend this hotel and will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Take earplugs”
Reviews.Author: Chwarae422
Reviews.Content: The price was right, and the room, although older, was comfortable and clean. However...... sitting on the patio we heard the neightbor urinating in his bathroom. Later that evening we heard lots more noise from the adjoining room, followed by snoring all night, effectively making sleep impossible. This is an older property, and the lack of insulation needs to be addressed. The location is great for touring the Napa area. The golf and tennis facilities are very nice and the landscaping makes it a pleasant setting. Food was ok. The spa was very good, and the services of all four therapist that we used was excellent - highly recommend the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: KMCray
Reviews.Content: I've never asked to change rooms before but did so when shown our first room. It had an fireplace that was poorly ventilated. I knew the smell would probably keep me up all night, so I asked for a different room; had same issue. Finally settled for a room w/out fireplace which was ok. However room still outdated. Lastly it was difficult to locate key ice machine. Overall it was difficult to navigate the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: JimS48
Reviews.Content: This supposedly 5 star resort was terrible. The staff were friendly and professional. However, the first night's deposit was charged at $53 more than booked. Our room was the size of a handkerchief. There was barely space to open two suitcases. The noise from the people in the unit above suggested there was no insulation between units. The noise from our own air conditioner was so loud we turned the TV volume up 8 points just to be able to hear the programs. It was certainly too noisy to be able to sleep. And finally don't be fooled by the room prices quoted on the internet. There is a mandatory resort fee of $20-22 a night

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but outdated”
Reviews.Author: bjop13
Reviews.Content: This place was not bad. We stayed here one night during our Napa wine trip. The room was clean, but a little outdated. We felt like we were in the 70's or early 80's. The other problem is that it is really spread out so you have long walks to take all the time. The offer a little shuttle but it sometimes took very long (20min) til the shuttle showed up. And the last thing, there are tons of kids. We tried to go to the pool but it was pretty much owned by the kids. So, if you have kids it's a great place, but if you are a couple and looking for something romantic, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “So reliable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Orlando1944
Reviews.Content: We live only 90 minutes from Silverado and love to stay there when we visit the Napa Valley. The hotel is so comfortable and has a very genteel feeling to it. The cottages are so well appointed. Having a small kitchen to have a quick breakfast makes it perfect for us. The size of the rooms are large so you don't feel crowded. Having a view of the golf course from the living room and bedroom was so pleasant. The Grill had a very nice lunch menu and service was great. The Spa is beautiful. Honestly, it's one of the best places to just get away and relax and doesn't cost too much.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience - Good Night Sleep combined with Horrible Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lindaj99
Reviews.Content: I'm mixed on this place. While we did have a good night sleep on a very comfortable bed and a great shower in the morning (with several shower heads pointing at us!), the overall experience wasn't a 4 star feeling. I'd give it two or three stars, because the property, although old, still is located in a great part of Napa and they have a lot of beautiful landscaping and some nice touches in the rooms. The big disappointment here, however, is the staff. They could care less about the experiences you have in your room . . . I tried telling the gal at the front desk about the fact that our TV didn't work the whole time we were there, and all she could care about was making certain that we got dinged for a $20-a-day "resort fee." Hey, I don't understand these BS resort fees anyway . . . why don't they just jack up the rate? How impressive is it to find out at the end that you owe money for something that is supposed to cover the "resort" aspects of your stay? Anyway, put aside the nasty people at the front desk and the broken TV and such, and we still had a good nights sleep and got to see beautiful Napa at a fair price. I would ONLY book this resort if you are getting some kind of bargain on an internet site and stay clear of booking this for a convention unless you look through EVERY room, because they are all individually owned and there is a great difference in quality. Once your attendees book, you know they will not be looked after by quality help from the front desk, so caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service, stunning property, pure pleasure and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: SJNorman
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Napa was highlighted by our stay at this amazing property. The staff were professional, courteous, pleasant and knowledgeable, especially Ms. Ortiz at the Front Desk. We were astonished by the beauty and serenity of the property and we truly felt like VIPs everywhere we went. There is no winery on the property but for wine tasting we popped right across the street to tour both the William Hill and Del Dotto wineries. We also toured several other wineries just minutes away and our overall experience was phenomenal. Thank you to the Silverado and its staff for making this trip to Napa one of the most romantic, pleasurable and memorable get-aways ever!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Foodiedunedin
Reviews.Content: This place was 2 star at best! Condo complex, tiny rooms. Much better choices elsewhere. I wish I would have listened to the bad reviews and booked the suite downtown

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Npin
Reviews.Content: I went to the Silverado resort for a wedding. For the price of the room ($165 at a group discount rate) I was expecting a little more than what seemed to be a cheap motel room. My room didn't have a real door, but a sliding glass door that opened into a small patio. There was another door that led to a joining room where you could hear everything that was going on. All the staff (aside from the front desk staff) were very nice and courteous. When I arrived at the hotel, I "checked-in" on face book. I was happy to see that the hotel had a promotion, if you checked in you got 15% off your room rate at check out. When I went to check out, I was first told that it had expired on May 12 (then why did it offer it to me, and where was the expiration?!?!?). When I contested, she said, that it didn't apply because I already had a discounted group rate (there were no exclusions on the offer). Look, I don't have a hard time spending money on a room if its worth it. But the rooms are old, outdated, have gross carpet and old air conditioning units. If you are going to Napa there are PLENTY of better places to stay than at the Silverado Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room and Stay”
Reviews.Author: JasonInLA
Reviews.Content: Overpriced. For the cost of our stay (about $220 per night, plus tax), I expected much more from this old girl. Unfortunately, some time ago (maybe the 1970s?) the resort built ALOT of condos several long blocks from the main hotel. The units are very small and not particularly inviting, and they're all crowded together. Sort of like a big, low-end apartment complex. Nothing special about them at all. On the other hand, they are clean. I won't recommend the "resort" to anyone. Much better places for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “True luxury resort in the heart of Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: SacramentoTraveler86
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Silverado several times for work as well as leisure travel. The resort has exceptional accomodations which includes two golf courses, several pools and tennis courts, a top notch spa, and a great 4 star restaurant. It's situated in a very quiet section of Napa away from the hustle and bussle of downtown with lots of great wildlife surrounding you.

Reviews.Title: “For such a grand resort it ought to include more amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Charisma1963
Reviews.Content: The landscape is wonderful; the rooms are beautiful; room service was very pleasent and attentive. What was very upsetting was to go online and find that there are packages available that include Spa time daily as well as food credit etc... We stayed here in room 777, a two bedroom suite with double occupancy being the only criteria needed to make the amenities mentioned above included... So why weren't they???? The Cache Creek Tribe that booked/paid for our stay here has been a charitable contributor, I feel at the time of booking it could have been suggested/included as the room was/is booked for four nights.

Reviews.Title: “what a place!”
Reviews.Author: neumanco
Reviews.Content: My family...four generations..gathered at Silverado for a celebration of my Mother's 90th birthday. The service, the golf, the food, the staff were five stars. This place should be on everyone's bucket list.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanh33
Reviews.Content: Everything at the resort was first class. Close to many wineries. A beautiful property with a great setting. Didn't play golf. The course has a great reputation. Enjoy a trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated, nice location, plenty of room”
Reviews.Author: divisaderoguy
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of our recently-renovated condo unit - well-equipped and comfortable for our group of three with two bedrooms adjoining a living room with fully-equipped kitchen. As it's an older golf resort there's plenty of lateral room to spread out on the pleasant grounds. The hotel has plenty of pools in the warm season; the smaller of the two main pools was available in mid-April. We were disappointed that the pool and other facilities at the recently-completed spa were off limits to children under 16 - even bikes were not available. Had we known that, for this outing we might have chosen a different spot. Also be aware that in addition to the "resort fee" levied on the rates there are additional charges to access the spa changing rooms and facilities as well as the pool at the spa - which are waived for any day you book a treatment. Messaging about this could have been a little clearer. The hotel is close to everything in Napa, but feels just a little removed, which is a nice balance.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: pt0wnfamily
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay - especially the warm pool (which provided many hours of enjoyment even in the rain!). Great location and the special we took advantage of was a good value. As long as the pool is that warm year around - we will definately be regular visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Has Potential...”
Reviews.Author: LauraG12345
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations when I booked at the Silverado Resort. The resort is a bit dated, doesn't draw many people under the ago of 50, and is not great. The spa building & work out facilities were great. The one restaurant that they had open was ok, but otherwise we stayed and did a lot off property. Our room was less than desierable. The main door was a patio door, and the second bed couldn't see the television. The bathroom door didn't open all the way because the space was so small the door hit the toilet when you opened it. Not a place I will go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable stay...”
Reviews.Author: vestnest
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding time my girlfiends and I had last weekend. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. The service was incredible! Our rooms were clean and updated as well. If you want to venture off the beautiful Silverado property, Del Dotto Winery across the street from Silverado has fabulous wines and an unbelievable setting. I highly recommend Silverado and I most definitely will return in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like royalty!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmingi
Reviews.Content: This was the third year back with girlfriends to wine taste and watch the Academy Awards. We had a 3 bedroom/2 bath condo with full kitchen. It was clean, relaxing, quiet and beautiful. The office staff and Manager, John were incredible. They made our visit so worth being there. We will definitely be making it back to the Silverado year after year after year! Thank you for treating us so well John.... you are a gem to this resort!!!!

Reviews.Title: “still needs to be updated”
Reviews.Author: SFO_traveler001
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in the 90's and it hasn't changed much since then. The bathroom may have been updated slightly. The beds are terrible! They are hard as a rock as well as the pillows. The walls and floors are thin. I was woken up by a group of people getting prepared for an extremely early tee time. I could hear them get ready in their bathroom, then I heard them walk outside and talk to the staff person that picked them up. The heater in the standard room is like a jet engine when it fires up (which is quite often when it's cold outside). It is placed high up on the wall that is facing the foot of the bed. Everytime it fired up, I woke up. For the price, it's probably better to stay somewhere else if you just need a place to stay in Napa. You can sleep better and then drive to the course for your tee time.

Reviews.Title: “Real nice property....nice staff/service, room was fine....”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Silverado Resort for 3 nights in February 2011. I stayed in a single room (227) that was located real close to the golf shop and restaurant. Overall, I would recommend the property - while the room was a bit dated, it was comfortable and the service and people across the resort were excellent. As usual - The Good, The OK, and The Bad/Ugly The Good - Welcome/check-in. I arrived late on a Monday night in a downpour. Was greeted with a smile, and had the concierge/bell-hop Mack show me to my room and give me some background on the property. Very nice welcome, and I appreciated the escort to my room. - Service. From Rob in the business center, across the front desk, to the gym staff everyone was willing to help. I also chatted with a golf course employee who gave me the fascinating history of the club. - Meeting arrangements and food. We held a small team meeting and the staff did a nice job fulfilling our requests, and the food and snacks were well done and always full. - Room service. Upon arrival I was hungry. Room service came to the rescue in 20ish minutes with exactly what I ordered. The tuna tartare and cobb salad are highly recommended. - Gym. The fitness facilities (also had pool, tennis) were nice and adequate. Opening at 06:00, the gym offers enough machine for most. Water and towels were appreciated. - Free WiFi across the property. That worked! Well done. - Evening bar area. I suppose February is not the busiest month, so we were happy to see some folks in the bar area in the evening. Brian the bartender did a nice job and was fun to speak with. The OK - The bed. My bed was squeaky - very squeaky. While I was tired it didn't cause me much bother, but I'm certain my neighbors may have not appreciated when I rolled over at night. It was pretty loud! - The room overall. It was fine and comfortable. There was nothing outstanding, and nothing too out of whack. I did find the in-wall heating system a bit disappointing, as I has to set manually and then it ran at that setting all night. The shower was large and clean. The location. I was fine with the location, as we did some wine tasting and the furthest tasting we did was only about 25 minutes north. Yes, we needed a car service, but who wouldn't if you're going to enjoy wine. The Bad/Ugly - Nothing. Regrettably, I was unable to play gold, but the courses looked decent (flat and wide) from afar. Overall, I'd give this place a look - however note that this is NOT a hotel, but rather a group of apartments/condominiums that cut across the resort which appeared to be quite a large piece of land. Enjoy Napa! Jeremy

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing. Exactly what I wanted it to be: relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Quietnapa
Reviews.Content: Staff are tip-top excellent! Women's spa is fabulous! Great locker room: every amenity you need except your own make up! Really. Don't bring anything. Quiet. Women only hot tub, sauna, reading room. One appointment and you can come and go all that day, as much as you want! Fresh fruit kabobs, hot teas, flavored water, nuts, raisins. Out door sitting. Fantastic showers!! Pretty shampoo scent. It's just wonderful! Go. Treat yourself. It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean but dated...”
Reviews.Author: GeeMoneyCA
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay here so i wanted to comment. Both times i was with a group of girls in napa & we chose it for the pricing & the fact that they have roomy suites that conveniently sleep 4+ girls. Pros: Clean, 2 bedroom w/kitchenette was roomy, fireplace nice. Valet, bellhop guys were great. Brunch was good. Cons: far from napa area wineries, older hotel, spread out, older decor. Both times we stayed in outlying areas. 1st time I could have sworn we were staying at a 70's condo vs. a semi-upscale hotel. Loved the fireplace & view of the golf course but it was really far from the main building, restaurant, etc. Also, someone had taken our parking place in the reserved, carport in front of our room & it was pouring down rain & we had to wait about 20 minutes for the person to move their car. The 2nd time was in November & after requesting the main building (not even sure now if they rent rooms in the cute main building?), we got another room past the tennis courts but a bit closer to the main building (but still looked like an older apartment style/condo). The gardners started pretty early on the weekends (& outside our window) so we unfortunately heard a lot of hub bub going on in the early morning hours on a Sunday. I would recommend this hotel if you arent picky & used to newer hotels. Please be advised that the cute picture on the website is the main building only & you will most likely not be staying there. They really should invest in a facelift for the outlying buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort for Golf, Tennis and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: We go to the Napa Valley and the CA wine country fairly often. We usually prefer to stay further north, deeper into the valley because it is more convenient for wine tasting and restaurants. Yountville and St Helena are 15 minutes to 1/2 hour away respectively and a $30/each way cab ride. Silverado, which is closer to the city of Napa, is a nice, spacious, well maintained property ideal for country club type activities. We did not golf, use the pools or tennis due to weather in January but they all looked inviting. We did use the spa and fitness center and had lovely treatments. The condos are individually owned, decorated and maintained. Ours was nice but I heard reviews that many of the units are in definite need of updating. Some room locations looked dark and tucked away. I believe the management rates the quality of the unit so make sure you ask which you will be assigned before securing a specific one. I have also heard that the resort has changed hands and there are big upgrades planned. We did not hear other guests (off season so I am not sure how full the property was) but did hear some road noise. Unit location is key. We did not eat in any of the restaurants since outstanding dining is located in Napa, Yountville, etc. It might be a good location for a corporate retreat or conference or even a wedding. Staff was outstanding. Everyone was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We come to Napa at least twice a year and this is our 2nd stay this year at this property. We love it! This time, we came during peak season (Labor Day) and were able to see the grapes on the vines and enjoy their pools in the daytime heat. The hotel is awesome and worth every penny. It's a great, quite location and the pools and grounds are really nice. If you want 2 for 1 deals to wineries, they have coupons at the front desk to just about every winery there. We love this place and highly recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest / Customer Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt_A_Non
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer / guest service. Arrived for a four day stay for a conference looking forward to swimming every day in what had been described as an excellent 25 meter outdoor lap pool only to learn that there would be an extra daily fee to use that pool, per person, on top of the resort fee. I was unhappy about that and let the front desk know of my disappointment. Liz Accardo, the Front Desk Manager offered to waive that fee for us for the duration of the stay: no fuss or argument. Ms. Accordo made our stay! Besides that the one bedroom suite with kitchen, wood burning fireplace, was excellent (if a bit outdated), and clean. Housekeeping was great. We had a great stay. Went wine tasting at the many local winerys. I recommend this Resort and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, rejuvinating, elegant...much better than cooking Thanksgiving dinner all day.”
Reviews.Author: cnfbeltz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for Thanksgiving and had a wonderful time, The online pics really don't do it justice. The property is huge with many different types of accomodations. We stayed in a one room, very clean, comfortable, enough room for two. We were graciously greeted at the front steps of the mansion and quickly allowed to check in early. We wandered the grounds checking out where we would be dining for dinner. Dinner was scrunptious and nicely presented. We took a doggie bag and the waiter generously poured on fresh gravy. I spent most of the day being pampered at the spa - amazing. Would love to return in the summer for a longer stay, maybe bring the kids.

Reviews.Title: “New management problems”
Reviews.Author: travels38
Reviews.Content: ... will try to make this short ..... been going there 15 - 20 yrs .... with new management this last year they just closed their best restaurant BEFORE THE HOLIDAYS!? There have been cutbacks over the last few years but it has been reasonable.. The only restaurant left (The Grill) has an extremely limited menu or you're forced to the bar food appetizers. We played gold 2 days & were not told of now it being 3 - 9 hole courses and that part of the courses were cart path only - why can't they explain what is going on when you check-in? oh - I know why.... sigh ... and the Marshall - the only one telling people where to go - is extremely rude. Also - still a recurring problem - the Members drop in anywhere they want to pick up golf - any hole.. seriously! .... and where is a Marshall to complain to? - not to be found ... feedback to the management does no good either... Not going back - too much competition for my $$ to put up with it... too bad - they have had a great reputation

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Tlcuise1
Reviews.Content: Great staff Kacie and Stacy in the bar are so friendly I missed Angela in the grill I hope the day we were in was just her day off we did have our power go out twice in our room but was fixed almost immedately and we understand the inn has been around a long time and that'll happen. overall 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Return to Silverado”
Reviews.Author: sunnyshel
Reviews.Content: Returned for annual visit to find Silverado as good as ever. Just a nice place to be around--beautiful grounds, everything nearby. Room clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to stay and play ...”
Reviews.Author: saralamber
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful weekend in Napa at Silverado for a family wedding! Had a wonderful staff .. great rooms .. amazing, helpful, hospitable staff. The grounds are incredible .. wonderful pools .. wonderful food. We also had our own wedding at Silverado 9 years ago and all of our guests stayed there as well. The resort and service was fabulous then and still is. This time we had our 3 young children with us and it was great with them .. we had a 1 bedroom suite .. it worked out great. The full kitchen was awesome. Wish there had been a sleeper sofa in the living room, but we made it work without it. The kids had a great time! A wonderful place to stay and play .. we hope to visit Silverado again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “There is no place quite like it.....”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsGoodCa
Reviews.Content: You really do feel like you are in a different world when you stay at the Silverado Resort and Spa. I was looking forward to my getaway for a while and I tried not to get too excited as I often get disappointed but not this time. The experience was amazing and it truly felt like you were in Napa Valley. Not only did we check out the local vineyards but there was so much to do at the resort as well. We played tennis, golf and bocce ball. The spa was wonderful and my masseuse was really good. I would highly recommend staying and playing here. We loved it and can’t wait to be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a getaway, not for business”
Reviews.Author: ELK06
Reviews.Content: The resort grounds are enormous. My room, which was more like an apartment, was quite far from the main lodge. It would be quite a long walk if you did not drive. The area where my room was located was set up like an apartment complex. You drive up to your carport in front of your room. The street the rooms are located on is very very dark. I would not recommend single women to stay here. The hotel room is very nice and comfortable. There is a kitchen, breakfast nook, living room, bedroom and large bathroom. This hotel is better for a week long getaway than for a one night business trip.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT spot for a Napa wine country stay!”
Reviews.Author: sulleygrl
Reviews.Content: This resort was SO beautiful! The main house is a renovated mansion from the late 1800's. The rooms are cozy, the breakfast was amazing, the spa is great. We didn't even get to the golf courses there, but they had tournaments going and room right off of the course if you're a golfing fan. The location was really close to all the wineries we wanted to hit too.
